review: We had a great experience here, I wasn't sure what to expect with a chain, I never am. Our server Brittany was fantastic, she courteously let me babble on about our horrible experience with food to you trying to get food from here about a month ago. She was just on top of everything. Just what I like when I go out. The food was above what I was expecting, I got the white pizza(could leave off the ricotta), lettuce wraps (OMG YUM) and my husband got the tortilla soup and fish tacos, which he enjoyed a lot. We even ordered more lettuce wraps to take home, the sauce was delish! One thing, as an old school server myself that drives me nuts, is if you are obviously looking around for someone and no one notices. I was looking around, just sorta looking, and the manager took note immediately, so I called him over just to say we had  had great food and service. I am happy.  The only thing I would change is the location. In our quote troubled economy unquote the mall was a ZOO (Are Americans THAT well trained to consume goods?) the parking lot was hell and impossible to maneuver. We had gone to Loehman's plaza, cause there used to be a CPK there, but it was gone.  I might order from food to you just so I don't EVER have to go near Arden mall again, but THOSE FOLKS really need to get their ___ together! Overall, great experience at CPK!

This is my first visit to any California Pizza Kitchen.  My friend took me here toward closing time at night, and we each ordered a pizza.   I did not know that this is how it works here, where one person orders a whole pizza, but indeed, we were each able to eat the whole pizza.  It's a light pizza with a light crust.   It's good, and the ingredients are good, so it goes down pretty quick.  I must admit that I do prefer a more traditional pizza and crust, but this was good for a change of pace.  The crust is sort of like a thick tortilla.  Service was good.  I will give it 3.5 stars and an extra .5 for the service and environment.

I actually don't think of CPK as a pizza place, but I like it.  Been a fan for ten+ years.  We were regulars at the Walnut Creek store when we lived there, and have been to the Arden store numerous times since moving to Arden-Arcade seven years ago. Between my wife and me, we've probably tried everything on the menu.  Do I like everything? No.  But most of it is good, and I definitely have some favorite items. For me, the Sicilian pizza is comfort food.  All meat with some zip. Comfort for the wife is the mushroom pepperoni and sausage pizza (a.k.a the "mupsa"). If you need a traditional kind of pizza, you can rely on either of the above. The roasted pear and gorgonzola pizza is one I am glad they brought back.  If you're a pizza purist that thinks pizza can only be tomato sauce, cheese, and meat, you just won't be happy.  They took this one off the menu for a while but people like me complained.  I don't order every time I come in, but I got it once in while.  A lot of others apparently felt the same way so they brought it back. The Thai chicken and BBQ chicken pizzas are also among my favorites and are probably original menu items.  And they have several good pasta dishes.  The kung pao spaghetti is really good (though I ask for it made with fettuccine), but it isn't Chinese food, OK? The service is consistently good.  I have panned service in places based on one or two visits, and it isn't like CPK has never had an off night.  But I have been here MANY... MANY... times, and would say that on average, they are spot on with great service.  We're regulars here for a reason. None of this is to say that I won't eat at a traditional pizza place.  In fact, there are plenty of times I prefer the family owned pizza parlor close-by in Carmichael.

Great experience for dinner with the girlfriend.  We arrived around 6:30pm on a Saturday night.  It was pretty crowded, but was told there was going to be a 15 minute wait.  That was really quick for me, because I was expecting more of a 30 minute wait at the most.  Service was excellent!  Very nice, always checking up on us, multiple servers, and friendly.   Their food is normal, the typical variety of pizzas, about 10 different pasta choices, a few appetizers, soup, and salad.  The pizzas are all around $12 and filled me up.  It's thin crust, so it might not be super feeling, but it was perfect for me.  Based on food alone, I may give this place a 3.5 or 4 stars, but overall experience was worth a 5.  This is in a great location because it seems like every CPK is located in a mall.
The food here was what you would expect from CPK, though the service was just okay on a recent visit.

Went here with my parents while I was home. I've been to several CPKs throughout California and this one was probably the best.  Frankly the food at CPK isn't anything extraordinary, but this time the pizzas were done well and the service was spectacular (hence the 4 stars).  I believe we got the wild mushrooms pizza, the grilled veggies one and a meat one. I can't speak on the last one but the first two were good.

Excellent lunch with the grandparents a few days ago.  I am not a huge fan of chain restaurants, but this is one place everyone can agree on so sometimes we go for pizza and salad.   I always get a salad, in the interest of fitting into my skinny jeans again one day, but I usually manage to pilfer a small slice of pizza from someone else at the table!  This time I was pleasantly rewarded.  My grandmother ordered the five cheese pizza, which comes topped with tomato slices and basil.  OMG.  This may have been the tastiest pizza I have ever had.  Tons of cheese, nice flavors.  Are we really at CPK?  Wow.  I highly recommend this pizza.  We also had a cobb salad, broccoli-artichoke soup, and (my favorite) the moroccan chicken salad, which I usually order with the dijon balsamic instead of the dressing it comes with.  I always get either the moroccan chicken or the roasted vegetable salad, and they are both dynamite.  Everything we ate that day was tasty, and the service was excellent. Our server, Jessica, was pleasant, prompt, and very patient.  The hostess, whose name I can't remember (I remember she said she was Puerto Rican and Mexican, had dark curly hair and was very kind), was enthusiastic and polite. She was patient with my elderly grandmother, who takes awhile to walk to the table, and even spoke Spanish to her when she realized that might be easier for her (my grandma doesn't speak much English). So, even though CPK is not my first choice when dining out, I have to admit the memory of that 5 cheese pizza still stands out in my mind...maybe I will skip the salad, wear stretchy pants, and order one for myself next time.  :)

Ive been here a few times, always have recieved good service and good food. Its a little pricy so i dont get to come in too often, but its always i treat. i like the different style of food combinations. I cant wait to come here again and try something new. i love how they have many healthy food options and very tasty drinks as well. this is a good place for a lunch with friends or a date with your significant other. I definatly plan on coming here again!
It's CPK, yeah its a bit expensive but where else can you find a wide array of selections on pizza and salads.....I like this place on a few and far between occasion. No real complaints.

I love this place. Pizza is one of my favorite food, and CPK always satisfies my craving. I go here with my friends once in a while and they all love it too. It is a great hang out place since it is basically right next to the mall and the theaters. The meat cravers pizza is my favorite. The prices may be a bit expensive but it is worth it. The service is mostly good, I have no complaints. I will definitely be going back, no doubt about that.

This place is not a bad restaurant but it's just not for me and here's why. 1. I really don't need a waitress/waiter when it comes to pizza. I 'd rather save the 15% I spent on a tip and get a pizza to go from somewhere and eat it in the comfort of my home. 2. The pizza's are small and only come in one size. The pizzas are cut into six slices and me and my girlfriend shared one and each of us had a salad. If I didn't have the salad I could have easily eaten one by myself.  3. The pizzas are expensive. I paid $13 for a six slice Chicken and Garlic pizza. My dollar could go way farther somewhere else. Don't get me wrong, the food tasted fine. It was fresh, non greasy, and there was a good variety to choose from. But at the end of the day it just was not worth the tab I racked up. I'm glad I tried it but I definitely won't be going back.
I love this place the treat you always super nicely I have made friends with the the employes and love them! Good food great attitude towards customers

The service here is good and the staff is friendly enough. The food is typical of CPK and well rounded but their menu has not changed much. Ambiance is something that needs to change a bit, as it has not changed over the years, but all in all clean. A good place to go as a backup if you have no where else to go or if you want to be in a sit-in restaurant after going to the theater next door.

It would be hard to make a bad tasting pizza and I can say that CPK has mastered making unique pizzas. They definitely have a large range of pizzas to choose from. They had a chicken club pizza which is exactly like a chicken club sandwich, except they added greens on top. I had never seen a pizza with fresh greens on top but it did taste great. And this means you are gettting pizza and a salad for one! They have a lot of pizzas with salads on top, so I would recommend trying those! The flat bread pizza is a bit bigger than the regular crust pizza..that is why they charge $1.50 more to make your pizza flat bread. And we cant forget the free house bread, YUM! You have to ask for it so make sure you do...nice and soft!

I am the unofficial ambassador for CPK! Well, my family & friends seem to think this. Apparently I love this place soooo much,  everyone in my life thinks CPK is synonymous with ME! Their menu is large, but not overwhelming. You aren't limited to just pizza, and their flavors are boundless - traditional to unique. I've tried almost everything on their menu, I proudly state this by the way, and I can get down with almost anything...but I do have my faves and go-to's! All time faves list: Apps - spinach dip and the avocado egg rolls Salads - Chinese chicken salad and the Cesar Pizza - Roasted Chicken Garlic and Tostada, sans beans :/ Other - the Chicken sandwich on their delicious focaccia Desert - Butter-cake thing or apple crisp I do appreciate their libations, however they are steep. They pretty much only carry top shelf, so pricing is premium! Their cocktail list is girly, in general, but there are some good options - again, if you don't mind forking over your arm or leg. For this being an establishment in my top 5, this is lacking a star due to customer service. Turnover is high - so quality of employees isn't always on par. There have been good times...and bad, but I ALWAYS come back for the food. It comes with the territory of having one of your top 5's be a chain restaurant. CPK are my favorite initials :)

Yes it is a chain and at first glance really doesn't stand out. But I have been going here for the past ten years and it is a reliable establishment to get good food at a decent price.  I really love their new small plates menu, nothing is over $5. And they now offer wine by the glass in several different  ounce sizes. You really can come here for a drink and a small bite for under $10 dollars. Service is usually prompt. They redecorated it years ago but sadly it already looks dated. A lot cannot be said for ambiance which is why they only get 3 stars. But CPK is a sure bet for good, consistent food.
Great roasted artichoke & spinach pizza! Yummy! Speedy pickup, perfect crust! I can't wait to eat inside!

Had lunch on a Sunday Afternoon. Service was quick and good. The only issue is that one of the Pizzas were made incorrectly and they had to remake it.  Service staff was professional and comped the pizza making this a good experience. Will return again!

Went out with a group of friends this week and after seeing a movie we thought we'd stop in CPK. I always get their Thai Chicken Pizza. Our server was cool and the food was decent (cmon it's CPK not fine dining!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!). He was great about refills and our order modifications. The big turnoff was the hostesses. Snarly, snipey rude ass b-tches. Man, they were hella rude to the couple in front of us and then pulled attitude with my buddy. I get it your working a minimum wage job and it may not be enough to pay for your 50 pounds of eyeliner and your crack habit (gottsta stay skinny) but that's no reason to act like a jerk to customers.

I've been here 2-3 times since my last review, and it continues to make me happy. I met my bff here for a weekday lunch, and we ordered white corn guac and chips small plate (nice and sweet guacamole with lots of corn), she ordered the Sicilian (thin crust with lots of thin crisp meat toppings), and I ordered the California Club (kinda like the club sandwich in pizza form, with large slices of avocado. I LOVE avocado). We finished our meal off with their wonderful belgian chocolate souffle cake a la mode. This dessert is amazing, especially for a chain restaurant.

This was a fun and interesting night.  Came here to grab a bite to eat.  It wasn't bad at all.  I've been here before and well it was really good last time. This time well..the sandwich i ordered well it was sloppy put together and well my friends pizza was cold.  Very unusual for CPK.  Although their drinks were strong for my friends. lol....and well the service was ok.  They only had 3 serves for a friday night and the wait was average.

I was so close to giving CPK my 5 star rating, until the last time I was there. Usually, CPK is a great place to dine with friends. The wait time usually isn't as ridiculous as another competitor down the way, so when we have a big party, we usually like to come here. Service is usually superb, and everything we order is always delicious and on point. Recently, it was a spontaneous girls night, and we decided to grab some dinner at CPK. We walked in to only a few tables that were occupied, yet the girl told us it would be a 15-20 minute wait. Whoa, there's tons of tables and there's only 3 of us, what gives? Well, they said they only had 3 servers for the night, so sitting us down wouldn't make sense, because it would take a server awhile to get to us. Hmm, interesting. Only 3 servers on a Friday night? Come on now. We were seated in about 15 minutes and our server was very prompt. We ordered a couple of drinks (really strong for my taste), and I ordered the caramelized peach salad, my sister ordered the margherita thin crust pizza, and my friend ordered the turkey club. Our food came out semi promptly, but the pizza my sister and I shared came out cold. Not warm, but  cold. The mozzarella didn't even have a chance to melt, so you could make out the small little circles of mozzarella on the dish. VERY disappointed, since this is one of my favorite pizzas. The salad was okay, but it felt like it was sitting on the counter forever because the lettuce was completely wilted when it got to the table. I would be willing to give this place another try.....later down the road.

I've only been to CPK twice, the first time I had a large party and was satisfied. The second time it was with a group of three and it wasn't that great. We walked into a relatively empty restaurant with optimal seating. Having asked for a table for 3, the hostess told us it would take at least 15-20 minutes. I find that odd seeing as how there were tables everywhere. We come to find out that there are only three servers...on a Friday night...umm okay, sure. Server was nice, prompt, and friendly. I order a Margherita pizza and an Apple Martini. Food and drinks came out relatively quick. However, my pizza was cold. Not like, warm...but cold. As in, sitting out for at least 15-20 minutes cold. Cheese had completely solidified by the time it got to me...cold.

This old standby, and one of the first to serve "gourmet" pizzas with non-traditional toppings on a non-traditional crust, is still consistent with their salads and pizza.  Service was average for a fast-paced and busy environment.  Our server was friendly enough, but we had to flag her down for a couple items. One thing that I hate at restaurants is being served bread that isn't warm or hot or fresh out of the oven.  This place is known for their oven-baked pizzas, so I would assume a loaf of their starter bread would be nice and hot, crunchy on the outside, soft in the middle.  This bread was COLD!  Fresh out-of-the-fridge cold!  So you know when you put a freshly baked loaf of bread in the fridge, it becomes hard and chewy and COLD!  Why would anybody serve that, and with some hard ass, cold butter to boot?!!!  We even asked our server if the bread was supposed to be cold.  She said yes.  That's ridiculous!  Seriously, CPK chefs/management...bread is not supposed to be served cold!

You just can't go wrong at CPK. We headed over there to relax a bit and get some grub.  Our server was pleasant as they come and always coming to check on us.  Meal was nice and hot too. So why only 4 stars instead of 5?  Because the meal was not FREE.  LOL!  Look, if you haven't experienced CPK, check them out, it's worth it.
I always love CPK's fresh cobb salad and bacon bbq sauce pizza very friendly service and great quality food in cheap prices :)

CPK is my place for when I'm in the mood for pizza but feeling a little more adventurous than your standard pepporini pizza (and have a little more money to spend, of course).  The food is consistently good and the cocktails are yummy. J's personal fav is the Habanero Carnitas pizza, although he says it could stand to be spicier. There are several menu items that always catch my eye that sadly I will never order, because I cannot stop ordering the Pear & Gorgonzola Pizza! OH SWEET THIN-CRUST PIZZA JESUS, THE PEAR AND GORGONZOLA!!! That pizza is good for words. Coherent words that make sense through excessive drooling, anyway.

Whenever I get hungry but don't know what to eat, pizza never fails to disappoint. I enjoyed CPK, but it wasn't absolutely amazing. in terms of pizza, I think the unhealthier deep dish pizzas from BJ's probably hits the spot even more.  What I did enjoy thoroughly...was their linguine and clams pasta. The sauce was scrumptious, must try!

Ordered two pizzas. I'm almost positive they changed the sauce on the thai chicken pizza. It doesn't taste the same. :(  And the lettuce wraps were decent, but lighten up on the salt and sauce please! Over done.  The most annoying part of the night was when the servers kept coming to our table but no one would SEE the EMPTY plate just sitting there for days. Could you have at least helped us clear some room so we can breathe a bit at our table and perhaps enjoy our meal?  It's okay, enough to feel the craving.

I've been to a few CPK's and this one is my favorite. Yup I know they all serve the same food, but the Arden Fair CPK never let me down. I like hanging out shopping in the mail after my meal and returning for a beer. The wait staff are friendly and courteous. If something is not fixed they way "you" want they will take care of it.  How cool is that!!!

I've been coming to CPK for years for mainly one reason... the Tiramisu!   Seriously, it's the best in town, I've tried it all, both upscale and hole in the walls. Sometimes I will have dinner elsewhere and simply come here for this dessert. It's perfection! The pizza is decent, I like the Sicilian. The atmosphere is a little dark and cold sometimes, but overall it's decent too.

GREAT SERVICE, GREAT FOOD! My fraternity and I have been coming here for the last three years to do out fundraising events! Each server/worker have been so great and friendly with our hectic large group of guests! I really appreciate how they go out of their way to serve each of us! Food wise: Last couple of times I've been here were UHHHMAZING! I have had their pizzas, pastas, desserts, appetizers, and alcoholic drinks! They make everything so delicious and perfect! Bartender definitely knows what he's doing ! And chefs/cooks are on point! All our orders came out in less than 15mins and were all freshly made!

Oh boy it has been five years since I had been here.  Which is weird because I like this place for both the salads and pizza.  Came here tonight for Valentines with the wife.  She picked CPK and I was cool with it.  We got super lucky and they were running a Valentines special which meant pick one appetizer(sesame chicken potstickers), two entrees(kung pao chicken spaghetti & BBQ chicken pizza) and to top it off we also got one dessert(Red Velvet Cake w/ice cream).  All of that for $30.  Great deal.  App would of been 8, dinner 15 & 13 with dessert 7.50+1.50 for ice cream.  Add that up(uses calculator because he is not smart)45 bucks!!!  Spaghetti was different but I liked it a lot and the BBQ chicken pizza was always classic.  Service was a little slow but nothing to complain about.  I was also surprised on the deal how many entrees they let you choose from(probably about 10).  Happy Made Up Hallmark Holliday everyone!!! P.S. Forgot to mention, the special actually runs through the weekend in case you were interested.

I am actually quite surprised by the less than awesome reviews for California Pizza Kitchen. I tempted to not go there but my boy kept urging that it's awesome etc. So we ended up there after a little shopping trip. The restaurant is nice, with huge booths each with its own window. A pretty big restaurant that would be good for groups. The hostess was sweet as well as our waitress. The waitress was a bit lacking in service, we did have to wait awhile for everything but not too bad. I got the California Club and he got the Jerk Chicken one. Next time we will have to get the famous BBQ chicken one! I've had the frozen version but I am sure the fresh one is much better. The pizza was nice and thin crusted. I liked the original crust a bit more thin the skinny one, which was a tad too skinny. The California Club was the winner out of the two. It had hunks of bacon, lettuce drenched in mayo, tomato, chicken and huge slabs of avocado. The Jerk Chicken one had good flavor, but wasn't too impressive.  The pizza was 13 dollars for an "individual" pizza. I did end up eating half, so it could be shared if you aren't super hungry.

THE BEST TIRAMISU EVER!!! No joke, get the tiramisu... even if you're not hungry save it for later. For just over $6, you can easily share this with someone and still have leftovers. Oh ya, the salads and pizza are killer too!

I had a surprisingly good experience at this location.  Three stars on value as the salad and therefore overall meal cost was overpriced for the amount served in a half portion. Standard order of BBQ chicken salad and a BBQ chicken pizza....I know so boring.  The menu is four stars as they are clearly trying to innovate.  Several pizza and salad options.  Good drink menu with many wine and drink options.   Interesting Diet Pepsi "mixed" drink menu.  Good customer service.  Clean restrooms I will return.

It would've been 2 stars but our server, Michael, was funny and great. There are 5 hosts standing at the front to ignore you when you come in; the place is half empty but there's a 10 minute wait. Then the general manager brought us our food wearing a uniform with food on it and our appetizer arrived with our entrees....And was cold. Fail CPK.
Always good.  I love the BBQ chicken salad. Crunchy fresh and yummy.  Pizzas are all good the chipolte chicken with the green sauce on top is my favorite
The service was the best service we have ever received at a CPK.  Alexis was fantastic!  The meal also rocked.  We had a Thai Chix Pizza and the Morrocan Salad.  Thanks Alexis for making it so great.

This is one of my fave places to eat.   The service is quite excellent.   The food is delicious.  Overall experience here is great.  We never had a problem nor waited for a long time to get seated. Will definitely go back and try other food ;)

Went with a group and found a staple in my pizza crust. A STAPLE. Told my server about it and she said "so do you want another one?" and I was a little taken aback by her blase attitude...does this happen often? Got another pizza sans staples. Later when I looked at the bill, I was charged for the pizza twice. We told the waitress and got it fixed but um....that's pretty sad customer service. I would have thought they would at least comp a pizza since it had a FRIGGIN staple in it... I dont know. That's just me.

This is the 3rd time I've eaten at this location so its about time I wrote a review.  I must say up front that the service is always attentive and at this visit it was very good in a Sacramento kind of way.  the server went out of his way to make sure to answer any questions and to be helpful.     I ordered Creamy pesto pasts and a salad off of the small plates menu and my partner ordered the pear and Gorgonzola pizza.  The one that I don't like about the menu is that it is a bit pricey.  They offer a large selections of salads but they are not really something I would order on the side due to cost.   they currently have a small plates menu and when you sign up for their "club" one item from the menu is free.  Our server set up up for this promotion so I was about to have a salad with my past without breaking the bank.    Pizza's are great here as they should be as its in the name CPK.  My pasta was good not great but I am not always in a pizza mood so its good to have a choice.  They also have Mexican food on the menu but it is always a bit confusing to me as if I wanted Mexican we would have gone to Mexican restaurant.

The General Manager, Scott Ramirez, is at his best when he is under fire.  When we visited the restaurant, he was short-staffed, and our order got lost in the shuffle.  When our food did arrive, my waldorf chicken salad was missing the chicken!  Scott took over the service to our table personally, remedied the missing items and delivered a complimentary new dessert for us to try.  He spent a few moments talking to us, and did a great job of salvaging the situation.  We appreciated his professionalism, and attention to detail.
Very different yet tasty pizza :) Love their tostada and lettuce wrap. Like to go to this place quite often.. once every 2-3 months.
This place never disappoints when you want a really good salad,  I also like the Jamacian Jerk Chicken Pizza.

Cpk has redeem my services! Last year, I came with my bf and service was horrible! But oh my, cpk's delicious hawaiin BBQ, jambalaya fettuccine, and crispy Mac and cheese appetizer filled our bellies with happiness! Waitress check on us and their apple sangria is yummy! will def visit again! :)

Had I written a review for this place a year ago, I'd have given it a 2.5 stars. I remember it tasting just ok and service being sluggish. However, in the last months this place has very noticeably ramped up their overall work. The menus have good new variety, so much that as a vegetarian I actually have many choices! A very solid 4 Stars. The prices make sense for the quality of food, which is significantly better than I ever recall it being.

For my dads birthday he wanted to go around trying pizza places throughout Sacramento and reviewing them. Then have me post them on his behalf. This is our fourth review. Parking and Location: 3 stars. It is in the mall. That sums it up pretty well. Looks From Outside: 4 stars: Just the way a mall should look. Nice big windows, updated look, and clean. Looks From Inside: 4 stars It was very clean and comfortable. Very generic chain restaurant look. Wait Time: 4 stars. We were sat very quickly, didn't wait long for food. Customer Service: 2 stars: Customer service was good until our food got there and we had no silverware, plates, or napkins.  It took us a long time to get someone's attention as our food got cold. Menu: 3 stars: The menu is very speratic. A pizza restaurant that serves Chinese, Mexican, Italian, and even a Korean dish. The drink menu was good, a nice selection of beers. Price: 3 stars: The price was very average for the one size fits all pizza style. Although my daughter ordered a thin crust pizza and I a regular pepperoni, her pizza was twice the size of mine with the same amount of toppings for the same price. Food: 2 stars : The sauce was a little sweet and tomato paste tasting. The pepperoni was just ok not overly spicy. The sausage was nothing special. It was a very generic unimpressive pizza. It reminded me of defrosted pizza. Our beer was bad. We told the manager and she said checked and said we got the bottom of the keg. Total: 3.25 stars: Either the food wasn't that awful or we were very hungry because we both finished our pizza. I can't say I will be back or recommend it anyone.
It's a great pizza, what else can you say.  Not the cheapest but reasonable for the fancyish incredients.  I loved the spicy meat one.  Dough, sauce, meat and cheeze it's the perfect combo!

My girlfriend introduced me to this place.  By far this place has the best pizza and pastas ever. I love the chipotle chicken pizza and the 4 cheese ravioli it is absolutely delicious. The chipotle chicken pizza has a spicy taste to it and that fulfills my taste buds. The 4 cheese ravioli is to die for, it's a perfect portion for one. To end the night I order the red velvet cake for desert.

Today was a Great Day for CPK, food was absolutely outstanding! Drinks perfect, the people here help make CPK what it is. Once their remodel is done I'm sure they even be better. This is a older style CPK but the staff was phenomenal. Come and enjoy

CPK always a solid option for good food.  The prices are too high, but they have unique pizzas with cravable flavors that you don't find elsewhere.  We usually go for lunch, and it tends to not be very busy.  Service is friendly and pretty prompt, and everything we've had is good.  My personal favorite is the "white" pizza, with added bacon!

The salads and pizza are well executed, and the customer service is friendly!  I have been here a couple of times, and each time it's been consistently good.  I like the arugula and asparagus salad, which is the stated ingredients plus peanuts in a light vinaigrette.  Its a nice started to the meal to come, and it has a nice mix of flavors.  Most recently I had the mushroom pizza on thin crust with truffle oil, which is extra but it pairs nicely with the umami flavor of the mushrooms.  This pizza rocked!  It had a perfectly crispy crust, rich and creamy cheese, an array of mushrooms that was topped off with a drizzle of truffle oil.  All of these decadent flavors were perfectly incorporated and each ingredient shined!  It is so simple yet so Devine!  The ambiance is bright, loud, and very open.  This made for a very kid friendly atmosphere and both my boys had a good time!  I liked the fact that they got little CPK reusable plastic cups with lids too!  Overalls is a great place tot ale the family and have a good meal!

I was very disappointed when I ordered the mushroom sausage pepperoni pizza because it was not as greasy as before and the basil that was added onto it totally threw me off. It added a sweetness that I wasn't expecting, and I could've done without it. I miss the old pizza style, they shouldn't have changed it. Our server was very nice and checked on us every now and then, he wasn't overwhelming us with his presence. The renovations are coming along, but I actually liked how it looked before. Overall this place should've never changed it's look OR it's menu. Very disappointing.

I highly recommend the Chicken Piccata...very tasty, yummy, and you can't find it everywhere.  Even though this is primarily a pizza place, I come here for the pasta and small plates. Don't be fooled by the fact that they don't display all their spirits behind the bar.  It's a full bar and the bartenders can customize your drinks as you like.

I have been to several California Pizza Kitchens over the last 15+ years since I was a teenager.  I have always looked forward to the delicious food, quality service and innovative menu. This is by far the worst CPK I have ever been to in my life and am appalled that after I contacted them, I have yet to hear back from the store.  We had a take out order of a grilled vegetable sandwich on herb onion focaccia bread with a side caesar and the crispy mac and cheese bites.  We placed this order a full 40 minutes before arriving as it was lunch time and we figured they might be busy. Upon arriving, our side salad was not ready and had to wait another 7 minutes for it.  They also had no bread and after waiting 4 more minutes, we just took our bag and left as we had a state conference at the double tree across the street.   Upon opening our items, the sandwich was on the wrong bread, the caesar barely filled 1/4 of the container, and there was no sauce with the mac and cheese bites.  While we were starving and had a full 5 more hours of our conference we began eating only to find A HAIR in our sandwich!? I can only presume it is this location as the CPK's in LA, Ventura and Santa Barbara counties have always been spot-on. I would definitely pick the Cheesecake Factory next time I come to this area.  What a disappointment.  And to still not be called back after relaying my dissatisfaction is beyond poor customer service.

I always thought California Pizza Kitchen had pretty decent food. About 15 or so years ago you could find me at the bar seating eating the Fettuccini with Garlic Cream Sauce add mushroom.  To this day my parents frequent this place and I often tag along.  Recently they have been updating their look. Wood floors, a new bar (apparently one will be a pizza bar and the other will be a bar strictly for alcohol). While walking past one evening we spotted all the renovations going on (they were still serving); so my father walks in and they said not only will they be getting the new bar, but they are going to be getting something like 6-8 new TVs in there! They have moved away from the bright yellow upholstery to a lime color. They aren't done renovating, but what I did notice were the cute painted pizza boxes have been taken down... I always loved looking at those. So we want in to dinner last night an they have offer these new flatbreads. I ordered the bianco: truffle oil, cheese, basil... YUM! We also ordered the spinach dip; they definitely stepped up their game on the taste of this dip, I don't even really remember the last time I had ordered it from there, but it was delicious!  The bread they serve is way better and it came with an olive oil dip! I'm glad some things didn't change though. I had the Thai crunch salad, still very delicious, but now I can actually enjoy eating the bread!  Way to go California pizza Kitchen!! I believe the changes you are making are positive and people will begin to enjoy you even more.

I'm apparently trying to break my own record to see how many times I can dine on pizza before I'm utterly repulsed by it. So far I'm still good at 4 times within a two weeks period. OY! Arrived at 7PM with a party of 11 total. Busy night for CPK. We had to wait around 15 minutes, during the wait, we were given a free appetizer of artichoke dip (yay and yum!). We were shortly seated afterwards. Customer service: 5 stars! Everyone was attentive and super friendly. They all attended to our questions and needs. TIPS: -Download their CPK app and create an account to get a free "Small Plate" I uploaded a menu of it. Max is 2 per a receipt, but they were friendly and gave us all 3 dish for free :) -If you sit by the pizza bar you get to watch the cooks at work, flipping dough and whatnot! -Free wifi Food: Spinach artichoke dip- The dip was nice and warm. Tasty. The chips were so-so, regular and purple colored chips. Pesto Cream Penne with shrimp- The pasta was sort of hard. The shrimp was big and flavorful. Portion is big enough for one or two people if you're splitting something else too. Overall, it was decent. Chicken Tequila Fettuccine- Had an unique taste to it, like a thai flavor. It was different from the normal pasta dishes we're used to. Hawaiian Pizza- my dad's must on a pizza is pineapple. They use fresh pineapples instead of ones from a can! So weird! All their pizzas are hand rolled! It was good agreed by everyone that tried it. Wild Mushroom- includes truffle oil. Didn't get to try :( But it was the first pizza to get snatched up! Didn't hear any complaints, so it must've been decent to delicious! Spicy Chipotle Chicken- didn't want to try. Heard it's a tad bit spicy, nothing you need to down a cup of water. Looks like there are a lot of different toppings, like a burrito exploded on a pizza haha Garlic Chicken Pizza- it's not on their menu but on the front page. It's one their popular pizza. I like this one a lot :) Our bill came out to be a bit over $100, not including the 18% gratuity they charged. Overall, I would come back again, for their service and food. It's really nice because it's located in the off-site mall food court. You should come check out the food stands around here rather than in the Arden mall, more and better options! :]

I recently went to cpk and had a fabulous experience. They just remodeled and everyrhing looks stunning. The regional manager was there and completely entertained my kids from the moment we walked in until we were seated. The food and customer service was amazing. Its one of our favorite spots

I cannot suggest this restaurant. We had a Salad and a Pizza to share! But the Pizza was served as cold as the Salad! Additionally you sit beside the Window which has only one glas and is fu**ing cold, so it helps to freeze your cold food. Maybe the soda is freeflow, but I did not get a second one! Thanks a lot!

It was my first visit in a long time and I"m wondering why I didn't return sooner. There is a reason for CPK's popularity: consistent dishes bursting with flavor, all centered around pizza - quite possibly our nation's most favorite food. Add in some Californication and you've got a recipe for success.  My gal and I split two noteworthy dishes: a crisp and light Thai salad that included veggies, rice sticks, wontons and cilantro, and a roasted artichoke and spinach thin crust pizza made with a decadent white sauce. Throughout the meal, our server was prompt and attentive without being obtrusive.  The only negative for me were the TVs. I'm already not a big fan of televisions in anything other than a bar. Our seats were situated under a big screen where one of the cable news channels was rattling on about the latest school shooting. An important issue, no doubt, but not the kind of tragedy appropriate for a casual dining situation with children in ear shot.
Great food, super nice and attentive waitress what more can one ask for..? P.s. Her name is brittany(::
Great food...pizza was tasty and not greasy like Pizza Hut...eewwwwe. Good variety on the menu. Customer service was fine as well. I go about once or twice a month :-p

Always my favorite pizza place cuz of the great menu of so many different types of foods.  Love everything especially the tortilla soup, bianco flatbread, Chinese chicken salad, lettuce wraps, and every pizza I've ever tried is delicious.   Really good kiddie Mac n cheese, too.
I wish I could've tried the food. Sat at our table and the server never showed up, maybe next time

I came here with a group of 12 from work for lunch and had a great time! The restaurant is very open and inviting with a lot of light and decorative accents. Oh, and the food is delish! It was crowded for lunch, but not too crowded to where there was a wait, so the place had a nice energy. Our server was attentive and sweet, she may have been new because she didn't know what a Chimay was and seemed a little nervous around our large group, but her service level didn't suffer. Every time I come to California Pizza Kitchen (which is a lot!) I always know what to expect which is great! The food is extremely consistent (Yay no surprises!) and the service is always good. We ordered the Thai Chicken Lettuce Wraps and the Spring Rolls for the table which everyone seemed to love (both had meat in them) and I ordered the Margherita Pizza which was amazing!! It had the perfect mix of olive oil, basil and cheese and when I added red pepper flakes it was perfect! Nice thin crispy crust too. Their pizzas are big enough for two people to share with an appetizer, or for one person to eat and have plenty for leftovers! I also had a glass of their Berry Sangria which was so great! Sangria for me can be hit or miss, so I tried this one based on a recommendation from a coworker. It came in a huge glass and was so good and refreshing! Definitely recommended if you like or even kind of like sangria. I would definitely come back here for lunch when I have a little more time, or if I am hungry at the mall and want a nice meal or snack!

Sicilian pizza! That's all I ever get and I savored it for dinner that night, breakfast the next morning and a lucky snack later in the day! They were in the midst of renovations but I imagine it'll look very nice when it's all done.

Came in on thursday, right before V-day, so they were running a $30 for 2 special. Food was alright, nothing stood out. Our waiter must of been new because he was bad. He forgot to give us the $30 price and rung our meal up separately. It was $20 more then expected. He couldn't pronouce CHIMAY and served it in a pint glass.  CPK please work on better training on your new hires. I guess an another employee was bout to get off and her bf was just hanging out in the dining room waiting for her. Really unprofessional there. He just sat there with a glass of waiter and their baby for 45 mins. A customer was vaping next to us also. All the food establishments I go to ask patrons for vape outside for the courtesy of others.

So as we arrive to Arden Mall, we are starving & don't want to wait until after shopping to eat We'd never been to California Pizza Kitchen so we decided to try it out.  We arrive & the greater said it would be a minute. Cool. We got seated soon after & boy was that an awkward walk to our seat. The lady was walking super slow & way too focused on who knows what. She didn't seem to be working at all. No hustle. And the stares on our way to our seat was so uncomfortable.  We looked at the menus & the reason why we chose this place was bc we wanted pizza. So we ordered the California Classic I believe (name might be wrong) and we substituted the bacon for pepperoni.  The wait time was fairly long. And it was not worth the wait. It arrives and it's a small round thing with a bunch of lettuce on top. What? I didn't know I had ordered a salad on my pizza. It has no sauce, just lettuce, tomatoes, avocado, some sort of really thin chicken & pepperoni. Maybe bc I'm not into eating healthy food but boy I had never tasted a pizza so bland in my life. It literally had NO flavor to it. I wish we would have just gone down the street to BJs and had awesome pizza for a little higher price.  The waitress only came around one time to ask how we were doing.  Then she called us "kids" when she brought the bill. What? Anyways. Probably won't be back here again. Well definitely not for pizza.  The only reason I won't give them one star is bc it's probably our fault for not liking healthy pizza. But I just think if their name had the word pizza in it, it would be good.

CPK has gone completely down the hill. The service here is always bad. This time they even served super stale tortilla chips with my super boiled artichoke dip. The pizza was burnt and all this even tho there were only 5 other people total in the entire place. I'll never return and I caution others to avoid the place.

I haven't been to cpk in years but it used to be one of my favorites. It seems like quality has gone way down to appeal to more people. It wasn't bad it was just ok which was really disappointing because I used to love it. I may try it again but it could just be another case of a restaurant evolving during the recession into gross food lol.

My mama wanted to come here as part of her birthday celebration, she loves this place. They have recently remodeled the interior so its light and airy and comfortable. They have a pretty extensive selection of items, as well as a 'light' menu. I chose the zucchini shrimp fettuccine dish and was pleasantly delighted! The zucchini was cooked perfectly with just enough crunch, not too soggy. It had a light but satisfying garlic olive oil dressing on it and it was under 600 calories! The service was just ok, we only saw our waitress when she initially took our order. Overall an enjoyable lunch time experience

Of the choices in the area it's always my go to.  The redesign of the restaurant was a nice one. The food has remained high quality and the aesthetics are improved. The bar is expanded and the selection has improved.  I always wind up getting one pizza with each half a different variety. This time I opened for a special instead of my standby.  Sunny side potato pizza - the egg on top was delicious. It was little heavier on the leeks than I would have opted for. Once I picked a few off it was perfect however.  Their raspberry lemonade is my go to when I don't want anything alcoholic. Having Angry Orchard on tap is also super nice when I want something a tad stronger than lemonade. Haha.  Even their more traditional pizzas like pepperoni or pepperoni and sausage are delicious. They have many other appetizer and entree options that are not pizza but really, why come here for anything than pizza? Order one of the pizza. They are the best.

I am a regular at this CPK. The wait staff if always perfect and so is the food. I eat here 3-4 times a month. The food is fresh, it is brought out quickly. The location is perfect because we can go shopping in Arden Mall then have dinner at CPK. The staff has always been attentive and professional. Never less than a 5 star experience for us.
The vegi pizza and mahi mahi tacos were pretty good. Lauren the manager was delightful and conscientious about all customers and made the slow server service bearable.  Thx again Lauren.

This was my 2nd visit in about 2 or 3 months. Both times I was blown away by the attentive service. Today, my boyfriend and I were checked on by about 3 or 4 different people. (It might have been a *really* slow hour.) Our waiter checked on us frequently and refilled our drinks as soon as our cups were getting low. Loved it! I love the new updated decor. The restaurant feels more homey in a way. Our waiter today said this location has been made a test location, which explains the new decor, the new menus, and the new menu items. I definitely liked the updates!  One thing I was sad about was tiramisu being taken off the menu. Not this location's fault. :( Otherwise, food was decent for the price. The boyfriend and I shared the garlic cream fettuccine, the California club pizza, and the Belgian chocolate soufflé cake. Food wasn't mind blowing but it certainly filled us up. Worth a visit if you're grabbing a bite to eat after a long day of shopping at the mall. Just be ready to pay about $10 a plate!
Food is good but very slow service took 20 minutes to get my bill and it wasn't even busy

My 1st and not sure if I'll return. The food was decent but kind of weird. The pizza was chewy and the crust was burnt. The service was ok, just a bit slow and the manager never showed to ask how things were going.

Liked the old look CPK had but it was a little outdated and was very commercial and cookie cutter chain restaurant. Love Love the new CPK! Feels like you are in a totally different restaurant but you already know the food is delish. The communal tables are fun and great for people watching. The bar is nice now we go to CPK due to its a destination restaurant not just because we are in the area. Keep up the great food and love the herb garden for fresh food and cocktails. Also noticed the customer service they have once again raised the bar. Customer service has always been fabulous at CPK but whatever changes they made to make each diner feel like they are friends please keep it up! Thank you CPK for making our Arden location be the first to have all the changes! Now I'm hungry!!!

I'm a fan of CPK! They remodeled the place and it looks way better and more modern and the decor has a fancy feel to it. I always order the California PIzza! Its like the best of both worlds of a pizza and a salad. It has bacon and avocado, omg so good!  Also, I'm still not quite sure how the happy hour works. Service can be a hit or miss.  Overall, I wouldn't frequent at CPK, however I'd come here for special occasions or once or twice every two months type of thing. Sidenote:When I think of CPK i always think about the youtube star that used to work at CPK and went full time doing YouTube. haha

their remodel is really nice. it use to look more like a typical pizza place with TVs to watch sports. then they remodeled to a more warm cabin welcome. I don't know I like it, I don't know about anyone else the food there is good. you can order anything off their menu and it should taste well the only problem is that if you go in to eat while there are huge party groups there, all the waitress/waiters will focus their attention to them and leave everyone else hanging around. it took my group of three 40min to even get a glass of water. none of the waiters were looking at us and they ignored us when we tried to get their attention. I complained to the manager, who happened to be there when we were and had said we had been waiting for almost an hour and still nothing served. we were about to leave to because nobody waits 40min for drinks. after someone finally came to us, only took us about 12-15min more for our food

I love the food here but it's a little pricy for the quantity size. After the remodel it looks a lot nicer. The BBQ chicken pizza is really good. I usually don't eat a lot and I got s pizza there usually personals and I got satisfied. So we also got an appetizer which was really great it was the lettuce wraps. They were delivious. I got them without mushrooms or cashews and the sauce was very tasty with the chicken. The spaghetti was kinda dry. I love saucy spaghetti. The desert here is really good. I got a red velvet cake that was moist and delicious.

I've been here several times now within the past year and something happened since I was here 5 years ago.  Their menu, service, and atmosphere is a whole star better! I love pizza but there's only so much you can do to it...  That is until you gobble up the unique tasty flavors that California Kitchen has to offer.  I mean who comes along and adds Lobster or Eggs to their pizza?  I'm a pan pizza type of guy, but CA Pizza's thin crusts are scrumptious. Try something different instead of the same Pepperoni you've been eating.

Tasty, not greasy, just what I was craving but didn't know! I've never been to a CPK, but this was a bit more elegant than I had expected. The crab and lobster flatbread was good, the crab was only slightly overcooked.  Not too fishy, but be sure to not order this as a main dish as it is not very filling. The biggest surprise was the sunny side up egg, potato, and bacon pizza.  The pizza bread was slightly thinner crusted than anticipated, but the egg and bacon on pizza was pleasantly surprising!  The potato was baked so tasted like chips.  It would be nice if there was an option to have additional eggs added onto the pizza because 2 doesn't seem like enough. Kids menu items were quite generous!  Fusilli and Alfredo was more than enough for my 5 year old.  The personal pizzas were more than enough for my older two.  Of course the pepperoni caused some greasiness, but it wasn't excessive. Bathroom was clean and kept up. Overall good experience, I would return.

Best pizza ever! I had the California club which was very good, our waiter was great also very nice and checked on us a lot. 1st time here and i loved it! Love their decorations,furniture and service.

Service and food today was HORRIBLE.  Seated and it wasn't busy.  14 minutes after being seated we got our drink order in.  (no bar drinks)  30 Minutes later we finally placed our food order.  1 hour into our wait, the food arrived. This might have been managed, had the food not been lousy.  The salmon was so overcooked it was ridiculous.  Burnt pizza, etc.  Went downhill from there.  Overpriced for what was delivered, poor execution, and lousy service.  Upon complaining to the manager he "was going to take care of it."  Apparently that meant a $4.50 credit for the lousy salmon on the salad. I can understand if you are out the door busy, service/time may suffer.  But, when you are slow and the service still sucks....thats just a reflection on management.

I get a little upset with these guys because they keep changing the menu, but since it gives me a chance to try new things..that I end up liking even better...I forgive them. Great service. Knowledgeable staff! Great food recommendations, and I appreciate that.

Just thinking about this place makes my taste buds go crazy ! I like to limit my Chinese food to a few times a year because of all the msg, this place has a killer Kung pao spaghetti! You will never leave with a to go bag! And you don't feel like you swallowed a whole bunch of salt! Full of flavor and the customer service there is pretty amazing ! They got out order wrong and my friend kept the plate they gave ha wrong and he didn't hesitate to take it off the bill, we didn't ask which was a plus, he went out of his way to make sure that we were well taken care of !

Food was good. Loved there spinach pizza. Service was terrible. We felt like racially discriminated. Waitress did not bring our water till we ask for it couple of times. We ordered drinks and they were sitting on the bar counter forever. Waitress just passing through serving other tables, bringing there water, drinks and food. Waitress won't bring our food and drinks. We were really disappointed. Never going back there even food was good.

Calzone Were Pretty Good But Pepperoni Pizza Is So, So                                              My folks and I had stopped here, service is food and helpful. Pepperoni were cut in paper-thin plus they had put on very little pepperoni with nearly no taste. This pizza taste something like just only cheese. Crust is very thin. Hardly any people come here around 6:30PM. Your choices; go elsewhere for pizza places.

So pretty much the same experience many people have had here. The service was EXTREMELY slow and it was not busy at all. The waitress seemed like she couldnt handle the tables she was assigned. Our drinks came out 45 mins after we ordered them. Food came out 20 mins after that. Probably wont be coming back

Came here the other day, I have never been to an actual CPK before but always bought their frozen pizzas at Safeway. There wasn't many people here which was surprising.  We were seated promptly and put in our drink orders. I ordered their spaghetti bolognese, my sister ordered some kind of chicken sandwich as well as my mom. We also got a back up of our favorite pizza, the Sicilian pizza. My spaghetti was tasteless, and did not stay hot for very long either. My sister and mom both said they were meeh, okay but not the best they have had. The pizza though, NEVER FAILS. Fresh and hot, always tasteful. That is one thing I will always eat. Also our server never really came back to check on us until it was time to pay. That is why it is rated 3 stars.

Great experience! Brittany was our server and went above and beyond. She was very informative and made sure to give us attentive service without being over bearing. The BBQ salad and Marg pizza were amazing! Wish we had saved room for the smores dessert, will definitely be back!

My husband and I were shopping at the mall, so decided to stop here for dinner.  Have been to various CPK's across the nation and this was about the same.  We started with the vegetarian egg rolls which were stuffed with eggplant, roasted veggies, and cheese served with marinara sauce.  DId not really care for these, but ate them because we were starving.  We split the mushroom pizza, which was pretty good.  My personal favorite is the tostada pizza, however would get this one again as well.  Kale salad (new item on the menu) sounded delish, but did not think I would be able to eat that plus the pizza.  Service was just mediocre.  We were never served bread as everyone else around us was and our drinks were never refilled without us asking.  Seemed like the server was too busy to give us adequate attention.  We did do a survey at the request of the hostess which got us $5 off our meal, as well as a coupon for $5 off our next meal.  Seems a bit pricey for the quality of the food-$35 between the 2 of us.

Have been here pently of times. Finally made it in today to see the new renovations. Very nice, but doesn't seem like a place to bring the kids anymore. Ordered one of my usuals: pep, mush & sausage pizza. Asked for them to take the basil & oregano out. Received it with hints of oregano (not a big deal) & a few pieces I could taste basil (not my fav at all with these toppings). Also it was extremely salty & the crust was thin... What happened to the thick & fluffy crust from before? Service was good. The server made sure to check on us enough.

I was on here the other day with my boyfriend. It was a great expirence. My server was very sweet and greated the traditional partisan onto food. The pizza was solicitous and for such a busy mall, it felt like it was its own little escape from the world. I liked the natural looking decorations and pictures hanging everywhere that have the place a California vibe!

Like a reliable old friend, California Pizza Kitchen is there to make you feel at home, feed you a good meal, and take care of you.  CPK delivers on all fronts.  This was one of their first locations to remodel for their new look, and even though I was skeptical at first, I think it works well.  Service here has always been terrific, and I feel like the food has gotten even better.  I particularly like the California Club pizza and am a big fan of their salads, while my wife almost always gets the Kung Pao spaghetti.  The beer selection is also good and even includes some local options.  The other thing that works well for us is the kids' menu - it ensures that everyone in the family goes home happy!

This was just as I expected so I am ok with giving it 3 stars. Food was tasty and just as I remembered from any CPK location.  Although, I did not receive the right order the first time it was quickly corrected and the day went on. Nothing new and nothing special.

In searching for a pizza place that understood that my wife has a bad reaction with cheese and would accommodate this, we discovered this place at Arden Mall. We were impressed with the courtesy shown, the restaurant atmosphere, and - wow, grown up pizza. We'll do that again, thanks!
I was in town today doing last minute Halloween shopping for my son and we had an amazing exp here, the pizza was fantastic . We will make it a point to visit every time we are in the area.

The price of mediocrity keeps rising. Canned diced tomatoes on a pizza? If you want a pizza with any tell-tale sign of flavor to it, go elsewhere. If I want any more of their pizza, I'll look for it in the frozen food section of the supermarket.

Okay for a chain restaurant.  DECOR: The decor is the best thing about this place. CPK-Arden was recently remolded. I love love love what they have done with the place. The place looks modern and clean...my favorite decor combo.  FOOD: The food is alright. *sign*. I really cant stand chain restaurants but I come here when my fiance and his mom make me. lol. I recently discovered the avocado chicken club egg rolls. Honestly just thinking about them is making me crave them. They are soooooo good. Perfect combo of flavors. They are actually a appetizer but I order them as my meal and I am stuffed after only three rolls.  STAFF: No complaints.  Overall, like I said I come here when I am forced to. I am sure I will be back against my will but at least I know I can grub on some yummy egg rolls if I have to come here.
Love this place. My husband and I always seem to find our way here while visiting Sacramento. Service is always good. And the food is also tasty.

A friend and I went out to dinner here. I have never been here as my friend has been here 'ages' ago, so we took awhile to order. We agreed on a appetizer & 'pizza' -roasted chicken with vegetables. One of the waitress bought us some of their style chips & guacamole and afterward came the appetizer (great dishes).  When we got our main course we received a dish , roasted chicken with veggies. I was confused because we came for pizzas. I told the waitress that we wanted the pizza; however my friend said we will take it, no worries it is our fault. Then went ahead and placed our order of the Roasted chicken pizza. We ate the chicken dish which was delicious !!! Loved it. The pizzas came afterward , I thought it was okay, maybe because I was a bit stuff from my previous course. We didn't finish our pizzas so asked it to go and our tab. The waitress then took and box our pizzas & brought the tab to us. She told us she took off the chicken dish since it wasn't what we wanted. I thought that was really nice of her; although we did love the chicken veggie dish! Something new to try. Great service & food.

Me and my husband went on Saturday night. I ordered Salmon and he ordered Halibut, the food was good. The service was a joke we had to ask for everything except our entree. Horrible Service. Then we were sitting at the table next to the window there was a couple who were literally standing in front of us for awhile, while we're trying to eat.
Love the food. They just took longer than I expected. They gave me a specific time and went 25+ mins more. Food was just sitting there..

This was my first time to this resturant and it was a terrible experience. The service is the worst. The food was ok, nothing to write home about. My salad didn't come with dressing, I had to ask for it. My pizza was totally burnt. Our waitress sat at the bar the whole time drinking a beer. The bartender was the only one helping us. I wouldn't recommend this place when BJs is just down the way and the food is much better and the service is better too.

Came here for lunch before my shopping escapade with mama and my cousin.  I was SO excited to see that they had the California Club Pizza which was the first pizza I had my first time at CPK.  I went to the CPK in Roseville about a year ago and they didn't have it -- said it was discontinued -- and I was so disappointed. Seeing it here really brought back memories and it's still as great as I remembered it to be!! Mama approved as well as my cousin.  We also ordered the spinach artichoke dip which is served warm with tortilla chips. Yumm!  We came on a good day and there were carolers who came in and sang some holiday jingles while we finished up.  This location is great with lots of natural light from the windows (though I did ask to move somewhere so my eyes wouldn't be burned lol). Our waitress checked up on us frequently which is always nice. Mmmm, I'm just thinking about the California Club again just writing this :3

I like CPK.  I've always had good success with their food and service.   This CPK in the Arden Fair shopping area is no different.   The place is clean, well maintained and inviting.  I've been there at a variety of times and most times the place is fairly empty.  So service has always been immediate.  I've gone with my co-workers and by myself and never had to wait.   The pizzas are always my favorite but have tried the soups before and they are definitely good.  CPK provides pretty good value for the price of the food.  When I go solo, I will typically sit at the pizza bar counter and most times the pizza chef or one of the other servers will chat with me.  I have met one of the managers of the restaurant and was even given a comp meal.   The food isn't fabulous but it is predictably good, hot and fresh, so you always know what you are going to get.   I like this location and the food, so I'm definitely coming back.

I came here the other night for the second time after YEARS.  I was grateful it was open on NYE when most of the other restaurants inside the shopping center were closed. This is a nice restaurant. It's a little on the dark side, (I could barely read my menu) but otherwise, the decor and vibe is pleasant. The food was good. My server was a very friendly and helpful young woman. I asked if their pizzas came in smaller sizes and she offered me a child sized version of the Hawaiian pizza I wanted, which was nice. I took a star off because I ordered a virgin strawberry daiquiri that tasted too sour.
Great food, great people, great time! Nice easy and always dependable! Nice service too. Always enjoyable

I love coming here. The remodel is way more current. I heard that they are a test store for new items too so the menu has different stuff than other CPKs. I've never had bad service here, everyone is so nice!  Try the Thai crunch salad. It's the most amazing thing ever. My most recent server was Joel. He was very professional and quick. Really stood out of all the times I have been there.

Blah. I love pizza. I love salad. Neither of these things were worth more than 2 stars. $11 for a half salad that was the size of a SIDE SALAD. Not okay.  Quality: it wasn't bad but it wasn't okay. If I wanted a mediocre lunch I'd go to McDonald's.   This place is all flash with nothing to back it up.

The food is great. However, the music today is like they are having a rave party. Very loud and energetic and annoying. Definitely a deterrent to returning. Salads here are so great. Fresh and clean tasting. Whole wheat pizza is fantastic.  Reasonable prices. Very friendly servers.
It is a decent establishment but sadly I saw a cockroach by the bar. I thought this place was remodeled recently.

CPK should just be called California Kitchen. There are so many things on the menu other than pizzas. They've got small plates, appetizers, salads, sandwiches; everything a regular chain restaurant would have.  Thanks to Yelp, I was able to get a free small plate after registering and downloading the CPK app. I got the the petite wedge with bleu cheese, bacon, tomatoes, and crumbled egg. At first, my friend and I thought it was a potato wedge with all of those things, or maybe a a batch of potato wedges. It was actually a just a wedge of iceberg lettuce. It is literally just a lazy person's salad. Just a wedge of lettuce with all of those things on top. Nothing special at all, but hey, it was free so I can't complain. My friend and I decided to just share one of their original hand-tossed pizzas; the original bbq chicken. This pizza had their "legendary" bbq sauce, smoked gouda, red onions and cilantro. The pizza was good, but I have had a lot better. If anyone wants good pizza, I would recommend pizza rock on K street.  Honestly, the best part of the pizza was when we asked for parmesan cheese and the red pepper flakes. The parmesan wasn't the usual form that comes in a packet, it was actual parmesan cheese that was grated. Sadly, besides the service, this was the best part of my meal. Our server was very friendly and gladly accepted my coupon for the free small plate even though it took a little work to try and find my account in their system. I felt the pizza was a little over priced for the quality and the size.

I go to California Pizza Kitchen whenever I am looking for something just slightly above casual. Good date place. I love their Thai Chicken Pizza. I also love that you can get half of one pizza type and a different kind on the other half. Their spinach and artichoke dip is great. There sliced fresh bread is great too. My favorite appetizer is the thai chicken eggrolls. So good. Their Sangrias are delicious too. My other half loves their Sicilian Pizza, but it's too much meat for my liking. Another great benefit to trying something new is that if you don't  like your food, you can switch it to something else. No hassle, no problem. They even encourage it. There service is great too. I have never had a bad experience here. The only not so great thing is that they took their tiramisu off the menu, and it was my favorite hands down to any other tiramisu that I have tried.
Food was delish and staff was very friendly. The service was a bit slow but they were busy and had bread to occupy us so that helped a ton!

My five stars is solely for the taco pizza! Best pizza I ever had! I hope they still have it when we visit again. It seems like it will be one of those choices on the menu that will only last if ppl order it

This restaurant chain have been around for a very long time, and I have never tried until recently. I've been on a Pizza craze lately trying pizza from everywhere. My Pizza was the California Club pizza, I felt like I was eating a salad on top of my pizza. It had fresh arugula, mozzarella and avocado slices on top of a cooked pizza with melted cheese and crispy bacon. All my fresh toppings kept sliding off. We also ordered a full sized Moroccan spicy chicken salad. Ehhh...... It was okay, I didn't like the dressing, the squash cubes and beet cubes were refreshing, chicken flavor was okay. MY server was really nice, the only good thing. My typical restaurant chain....never disappoints me too much because this is what I expect, mediocre food from a chain restaurant, especially being a part of the mall.

Wow its been awhile since we stopped in but after late night shopping at Arden Mall, happy that we chose CPK!! They delivered on quality and taste.   Nicole, the manager was awesome!  The crew was nice and attentive...
Tasty food... Try the chipotle pizza !! :) tummy happy ! Everything tasted good... Good for veggie folks too !
The spicy chicken pizza was awesome! also the garlic pasta was good The Sangria was awesome.

Food was 45 minutes late for curbside pick-up.  Finally they brought out the food and, *gasp* surprise! Wrong order! The runner girl was friendly at first but became very pissy with us as time went on. Girl comes running back 5 minutes later with the correct order, yay! We hand her a tip and before she takes off my wife looks through the new bag and says "Hey wait a minute, there still isn't any topping for my salad"  What does the runner girl do? In a very annoyed tone she says "Okay THANKS!" and runs off with her tip. We waited for about a half hour for this curbside experience which the company defines as a quick and easy way to get your food to go. It was neither quick, nor easy, and in the end we were STILL given the wrong food and CPK essentially told us "TOUGH LUCK!". Horrible customer service.  Now to the food!  We get home and, oh look, random things we didn't order are in the bag! Yay! Well let's just salvage our meal and- The food was so cold and so stiff that it became quickly apparent that it WAS ready when we first arrived, but just sat somewhere while we twiddled our thumbs for a half hour.  STONE cold. Stiff like cardboard. We threw it away. Avoid this place like the plague. I've had CPK before and the food itself (when fresh) is delicious, the problem with THIS place is the STAFF.  I look forward to an email from the manager trying to make this right - which based on the horrible service we had this evening - I will never receive.  Avoid this place until they fire some of the crappy staff and hire people who actually care about customers.
AMAZING SERVICE!!! Best guest service I have ever experienced. Defiantly my new favorite pizza restaurant in California.

The menu sucks. I am a PIZZA lover but this is just sad. its just a place that serves everything else and "by the way" we also have pizza. me and my friends wanted to try it out ut it wassing all that we expected. I expected we would have a wide variety of PIZZA SELECTION, but really i could have just gone to Pizza guys. I expected better. Don't get me wrong but a Pizza Kitchen is definitely suppose to look a lot different.
I'm neutral about this place.  I like how they keep the menu interesting, but it's not interesting enough to bring us back in.  I actually prefer the pastas instead of the pizzas.

Pretty good food for a decent price if you like Italian done the California way! Good choice of pizza made with excellent crust. Service was beyond great, they really made us feel at home. Never had to ask or wait they were always available.
Love love love pizza lover love this place great food drinks and salads the Bay Area locations are my fav but sac location not as good but decent  CPK has my heart delicous

The 1st time we went here it was really good and the service was excellent, although it was nearly empty. We went here for lunch on the 4th of July, there were more people here but it was not packed. The service was really slow. The server sat our drink on the Crack between the two tables and it spilled. I guess they didn't see it happen because the people next to us had to give us their napkins. I asked 3 people for another drink and finally got one as we were leaving. We ordered the Kung pao spaghetti and it was really sticky, like they didn't rinse the starch from the noodles. Not worth the cost. Maybe it was just an off day...

I went here with the family on Saturday. The experience started out good. We were greeted by the hostess and he seated us. Once we got our waiter it all went downhill from there. He did get our drinks correct and on time. We purposely went here at around 3:15 pm because we wanted to miss the lunch rush. So we ordered two appetizers and two pizzas to share. We got no bread until we literally asked three people for it. Then we got two plates of bread. We then had to ask for plates, napkins and silverware because none were provided. This should be standard. I didn't think we were Cavemen and had to eat with our hands or wipe our hands on our clothes.  But anyway, I can't even remember our waiter's name but we were seated directly to the right near the bar when you walk in at a table. The food is o.k. but the service is ugh and unacceptable. We ordered the Artichoke Dip some tacquitos and a pepperoni pizza and a sicilian pizza. The total bill came to around $63.00. Let's just say the waiter only got a $6.00 tip because I didn't have change. But come on we should have just bought some frozen CA pizzas at Safeway and called it a day. I will not frequent this business. The service was not cool.

Surrounded by the hustle and busyle b of ardent mall. No wifi. Service was quick.  Got the California club pizza.  This was tasty and refreshing having arugula and olive oil on tip of chicken and bacon. Base was chewy and crusty. A serving of bread with olive oil and pepper was offered.

Want some pizza? A delicious one? California Pizza Kitchen (CPK) has many combinations for you to try. My favorite? The Works. With one bite into The Works, your taste buds will get pepperoni, Italian sausage, mushrooms, green peppers, red onions, olives, oregano, and of course mozzarella. The crust and bottom of the pizza is crispy for that extra crunch. There are many other combinations of pizzas for you to choose from and each pizza has 6 slices so leftovers are highly probable. CPK also has appetizers, soups, salads, pastas, main entrees, and desserts. There is a bar where they serve wine, mixed drinks, and beer.  Of all the times I have been here, service has been great which made the visits more enjoyable. They refilled drinks, got us extra items like ranch, napkins, red pepper flakes, and cheese. Everyone greets us as we walk by and also engage in small chit chat.  CPK does have tvs all over the restaurant showing different sports games. The ambiance is pleasant to sit in and tables are located throughout the restaurant. CPK is located in Market Square which is between Macy's and Best Buy so the location is very convenient because it is walking distance from Arden Fair Mall.

Food was good as always. Gorgonzola and pear pizza was delish! But the staff was too chirpy and annoying .. How many times does everyone have to ask if we'd been there before.  Our waitress was extra annoying and chirpy . "How are we doing today? " "do we need anything else, " I'm not a preschooler and don't really like being talked down to like that. I've been in the restaurant business for over 20 years and get compliments from my customers all the time for being real and playful with them . customers are people, not preschoolers.

Came here for lunch on a Friday with a co-worker and it wasn't crowded, so no wait.  It's decorated tastefully and was very clean.  We were seated in a comfy booth by the window.  We both got BBQ chicken pizzas, with chicken tortilla soup, and corn/avocado dip with chips.  The food was very tasty and their lunch specials are good deals with many choices.  The complimentary bread with olive oil was ok, but not too much flavor.  I also tried their fresh strawberry mango refresher, which was very tasty and cooling on a warm day.   Service was friendly and professional - the only reason I am not giving 5 stars is because various servers, hostess, etc. came up to our table to check on us on at least 5-6 different times within a 20 minute period when we were trying to eat.  I appreciate attentiveness, but when they come by too often, it gets tedious.

Here's my secret shame. I eat like I'm in the third grade. My favorite thing on the world is their Mac and cheese! Thank goodness I had kids who ordered this so I could discover it. Everything else here is great. Food. Staff. Vibe. It's CPK. it's awesome.
Came in for late 1:30 PM lunch.  Food is good, but, the young staff suffers on the service side.  Not a great deal of communication in getting orders in, while restaurant is not crowded.

The food was awesome but our server, Mario, ended up being pretty shady.  A couple of us in our group payed cash and if we didn't ask for our change back, he wouldn't have given it back to us. It took a lot of badgering for him to come back around and give us our change.

I lost count on how many times we come here. We've been going there before their remodeling of the new CPK look.  The staff has always been great to us and never steer us wrong in food choices. We either go just for the pasta or the pizza, never both the same. There is also one person that recognized us as repeat customer; I don't know how because they are always busy there.  The happy hour is worth checking out. We haven't had a chance to do so, but based on their consistency with their food, I don't see why I can't recommend anyone not to go.

Uh. At quite an impasse! I love CPK. It is the only major chain besides In N Out that I visit regularly. Normally the food and service are fabulous, but this last visit was very disappointing. My Sicilian pizza was burned, and the service was noticeably ignoring our table.
