I still know the heart of this company is has great intentions, as they continuously support local charities and provide great jobs throughout the state, but I am hoping that the recent changes do not overshadow the simply good food and great service I have known throughout my life.

If you like a thin crust Margarita Pizza as much as I do, look no further because you'll never find one except here! I've tried many places that say they make one but alas, they haven't a clue. The salads at CPK are generous and delicious.

I came here to get my favorite pizza (Sicilian) but found out they had a rib eye and took the challenge.  This was by far the best ribeye I've had and the fingerling potatoes are to die for. It's obvious CPK wants to be more than just great pizza and they did it with the steak I had today.

I have been to CPK plenty of times with the staff being great,  as well as the food. I went in today with my family, got the usual food was great. The waitress was a little off in the beginning but lightened up an was attentive with good customer service. We were sat by the bar which wasn't an issue but over hearing the crew (employees on & off the clock) cursing saying what the f***. It is disturbing to hear while im trying to eat my lunch with my kids and family. Then to look over at the greeting counter to see 2 employees kissing. This is beyond unacceptable. This is the reason why i giving them 2stars.
Zulema is the best.  I have been eating lunch here for years and she makes it feel like home. Thank you

Thank you Ashley, our waitress, and Loren the manager for the amazing experience you gave us! It was beyond our expectations :) You simply made our day. I came here tonight with my family for the first time, Usually I order by phone and pick up my pizza when it is ready. We thought to come here and sit for a change! Long story short, the first part of the experience wasn't that good as we waited for so long! Ashley showed up soon after I told the guy on the counter. She, politely and genuinely apologized which made us feel much better :). She then offered us an appetizer for free to make it up for us, so far so good!.  We ordered our favorite pizzas: Margarita pizza ( + tomatoes and extra basil) and the BBQ chicken pizza. We also ordered the free appetizer, some pasta. By the way, I love the bread with the olive oil they serve for free.  We were so happy with the quality and the taste of our food, we enjoyed it. Ashley kept on checking on us making sure we are happy and enjoying our meal and time. We even chatted a little bit about our families and personal lives.  Once we were done, Ashley put the leftovers in boxes, thanked us, wished us a good night and then left. I was confused on where I should pay, i thought they will bring me the check!!! So I went and asked Ashley, here manager Loren was there and she said: "I got this, you waited so long (it wasn't that long actually) so i got this :) don't worry about it" and I was speechless, didn't know what to say.  It was, by far, the most amazing experience I had here in Sacramento, not because of the free food and the amazing service I received, but because they were sensitive and sincerely felt sorry for letting us wait. Loren and Ashley were sincere, polite, amazing and full of surprises. I would've been so happy with the free appetizer but no, they went beyond what was expected and made our night unforgettable .. this is what i call Delivering Happiness not just amazing food :).  Again, Thanks Loren and Ashley and congratulation California Pizza Kitchen for having such an amazing, loyal and creative people.
food is bomb as fuck but it is FREEZING COLD IN HERE. hard to enjoy the good food when ur worried about getting pneumonia

When I'm shopping in the Arden area this is one of my fallback places to go.  The bar area is nice enough and fast enough to salvage an otherwise overcrowded evening on the town. If you get pepperoni, spend the buck fifty and get the truffle oil.  then add the crushed red pepper & grated cheese.  Added a nice kick to an already good pizza. Rachel was delightful, courteous & attentive.

We visited CPK last weekend to grab a light dinner. It was about 7pm on Saturday and the restaurant was pretty busy (20-30 minute wait). The hostess offered us a couple open spots at the bar, so we didn't have to wait.   The chill of winter was settling in, so we asked our server of they could make a spiced cider or hot toddy. Our server wasn't immediately familiar with the recipe, but asked how we liked our toddy's and quickly came back with a self-serve style assortment of hot whiskey, tea, lemon, etc. It was exactly what we were looking for to start our meal! We ordered the mushroom pizza and split pea soup for dinner. The pizza dough was light and crisp, while the vegetables were perfectly cooked. The soup was similarly wonderful.  This was our first time here, and will definitely be back!

I usually shy away from writing reviews on chain restaurants, but after my visit to CPK yesterday -I just couldn't help myself. Like most self proclaimed " foodies" , I tend to seek out family owned restaurants that are different from the norm. Since it is in my nature to " fight the man" , I would rather spend my hard earned money supporting local businesses rather than add to the bottom line of corporate giants. However, sometimes I need the consistency and selection that a place like CPK offers. Here is my recap from my visit yesterday: 1. For Lunch , I chose " The Works" which is CPK's version of what I have always considered a "combination" pizza (pepperoni, sausage, mushrooms, red onion, green peppers, and olives). The tomato sauce  was flavorful , and was spread evenly throughout the pie. The cheese to toppings ratio was perfect, and CPK managed to not burn the crust despite being on the thinner side. With a dash of red peppers and parmesan cheese -my meal was complete. 2. My wife opted for the two-in-a bowl soup combination. The fact that both soups were served in the same bowl without some sort of divider surprised me a little bit. I expected some sort of customized bowl that prevented the 2 soups from intermingling. However, my wife made it work by eating the split pea soup first , and the baked potato soup after.  * Since my wife is pregnant , she couldn't stop there -lol. She also ordered a petite wedge salad that was on the menu under " small plates". The salad comes standard with blue cheese dressing  (she opted for ranch dressing instead) , bacon, egg, and tomatoes. The lettuce was not soggy,  and there was just enough dressing added. The attention to detail at CPK is amazing. The pizza, pasta, and salads are well crafted, and the ingredients used are top-notch.  CPK doesn't make the best pizza or pasta that I ever had, but they do everything well. When you are in the mood to eat but are not quite sure what you want, I would suggest giving CPK a try if you haven't already. However, since CPK operates in 30 + states- I am pretty sure you have tried it at least once.

Very bad experience.  My girlfriend wanted to have some pasta for lunch, so I decide to go to California pizza kitchen. We arrived here around 3:15 pm, and my girlfriend ordered chicken tequila fettuccine, strawberry mango cooler, and avocado egg roll. I was not sure what should I have, so I asked him come back for my order. After 20 min, there was nothing on the table. Another 10 min later, thanks god, the waiter finally remembered us. He brought my girlfriend's drink and checked our order. Then I ordered a mushroom pepperoni sausage pizza. 15 min later, we finally had egg roll and pizza on the table. Wait a second, what was our purpose to come here? Where was the pasta? You won't believe that the waiter came and apologized he forgot the pasta. Well, it had been 1 hour and 15 min, we finally had the pasta on the table. People who were behind us already checked out and left. Maybe the waiter was rushing the chef, the pasta was kinda tough to eat. I remember I had the same experience at Season 52 that they forgot one of my order, but they took out that order off the bill. Maybe that's the difference between a great restaurant and regular restaurant.

finally returned to try out the jambalaya & I'm so glad I did! it was absolutely delicious; a beautiful creole sauce, plenty of shrimp, chicken and sausage and a nice little kick in each bite.    the service was lot better this time around. I think his name was Jason or maybe James, I know it started with a J for sure. lol, he attended to our table very well. welcomed us with a friendly tone and smile. he also informed me about their rewards program. I guess you fill it out at the table and then the server adds it into the system. I was told I should get an email as a response but I never got anything... so I don't think he ever added me into the system...

First time coming to this location because moved closer to this area (regularly frequented the Bay Street Location). Comparing both services though, this location has Bay Street beat by several miles. The server was super attentive and didn't let our cups sit empty at the table without replacing them with a fresh new one. We didn't have to ask for the check or a take out box either because our waitress had it ready. For the life of me I cant remember her name, started with a C. Anyway, I would come back in a heartbeat. Bay Street can suck it because I will be coming here from now on.

I'm not a fan of pizza but I have to say this place make me changed my mind! I had the vegetables plus sausage pizza, it was the best pizza I had in my life! Would like to take my mom here next time so she can have a great one in a life time! Boy why didn't I try this place before? I did long ago but I had salad or other dishes! Good thing I have pizza this time!

the food was good. i ordered the tortilla spring rolls and kung pao spaghetti. the waitress didn't bring my mom her water, i had to tell her. also we had to ask for bread even though there was a table that came in after us, they got their bread before us. she was to busy at the bar just like the last visit. no tip was left for the waitress she sucked! she was quick to get the check.

Needed a break from holiday shopping, the crowds, traffic, wind and rain, so I ducked in for lunch and a cocktail.  The hostess was prompt and efficient, seating me quickly in a booth I requested.  My server was equally professional, prompt and friendly.  She recommended the Blood Orange Sangria, which was delicious!  I could have drank a pitcher of it!   I ordered a pizza/salad lunch combo.  The standout was the salad of spinach, quinoa, Granny Smith apples, dried cranberries and pecans with a sprinkle of parmesan on top.  The dressing was a light, creamy poppyseed. A perfect compliment to the salad. The pizza was mushroom, pepperoni and sausage.  Not particularly generous with the toppings and nothing especially notable about the taste or texture of the pie.  They only offer three pizza choices for the lunch special, which is unfortunate because they offer other, more interesting options under the full size pizza menu.  There really is no reason that they can't make any of the pizza's in the 7" personal size pie and I wish they would offer that option. I have always had wonderful service from the staff and the food is predictable, consistent in quality and flavor but nothing I would consider making a special trip to the restaurant to eat.

I've never eaten at this CPK location, but my experience here for the first time was pleasant. It's been quite awhile since I've eaten at CPK, but I did order the same pasta as last time because I remember really liking it. The chicken tequila fettuccine was yummy! It's such a unique taste for pasta and usually I'm not a big fan of pasta to begin with.  Overall, experience here wasn't bad at all, food was good, and service was good. I would come back again and update, if anything.

We waited almost 30 minutes when half of the restaurant was vacant. Our waitress was very odd, often times sarcastic & rude about our lack of knowledge of the menu. We even joked she could have been drunk. That's how weird she was. The food was horrible. I would rather eat Round Table. Terribly overpriced for food that tastes like vomit & bad service that makes you want to vomit. Never again.

Ordered (half) The Waldorf Chicken Salad. It was a tad pathetic.  Had four tiny pieces of Chicken (maybe 1/2" wide x 1 inch long. Seriously, not worth the $11.29 they charged me. My friend ordered the Thai crunch salad. Her salad on had two tiny pieces of chicken. Again, not worth the $11.49 she paid for it. Waiters are attentive and friendly. Salads were way overpriced for the amount of chicken received what you received. I did show my salad to the waiter and he took it back and had more chicken added. When my salad was returned it had  a good 2/3 of a cup of chicken. Also ordered a cup of their baked potato soup. That was stupendious. Mananger came to follow up with us. So...I raised the stars from two to four. Some times it pays to ask.  Special thanks to Austin our waiter for being a kind gentleman and meeting my complaint with a smile, and a can do attitude.
This is a great spot, plenty of parking although can get busy on the weekends. Superb staff. I had the BBQ CHICKEN SALAD it was really good! And sipped on the CARIBBEAN SUNSET SANGRIA. Super good!
The food was good. The service was very slow for the amount of people that were there at the time. Took an hour before we got our food from the time after ordering.

My husband and I travel about 50 miles to go to this restaurant for our fav's: Baja Spring Rolls & Smashed Pea Soup & Broccoli Sun-dried Tomato Fusilli (which is no longer on the menu). However, on our arrival, our server Jay greeted us warmly, remembered me from my last visit and asked what we'd like. When we told him out fav menu item wasn't on the menu, he was able to convey to the cook what we wanted and it was delivered just as flavorful and yummy as we hoped it would be. Our drinks were refilled as soon as they were getting low, even adding another glass of ice for my iced tea! (Don't you hate it when the ice melts!) We will return again, and make sure if Jay is available, will sit in his station. It was a great Valentine meal!
They make wonderful vegan pizza.  I have them on my speed dial.   People there seem vey friendly and welcoming.  Love the big screen TV, too.

I love this place for the food. The pizza is really good and so are the appetizers but the service is horrible. We don't mind waiting for our food understandable it can be busy but we went a while without getting a refill on our drinks and so many servers passed by us. They need to get better at organizing the services duties so we can have a better experience

I have been coming to this location for about 5 years now. I never had a problem until February 18th 2016.  My friend and I went out on a birthday lunch. It's been a while since we have met so we thought we would hang out and catch up on a few things. As we were in the front we were greeted "hello how's your day, please have a seat here" and as we responded "we are okay thanks for asking, can we pick a spot where there is no sun" and he said "oh I'll just put down the blinds, but that DID not help much". Anyways he was rude and we thought oh he's having a bad day or something.  Moving onto the waiter, I wish I knew his name but I for sure can recognize his face. He was a total wreck. Did not greet us well, slammed our drinks down, our food was great thanks to the chef and he tried to rush us out.  Since he gave us such a GREAT service we gave him a "zero tip and some written advice ".  Keep in mind that the restaurant was not packed. We were probably the only ones there with 2 other tables.  We won't be returning to this location AT ALL. 0 stars but 2 stars just because the food was great.

It didn't take too long (maybe 5-7 minutes max) to seat us, and our waitress was really nice and friendly. We ordered the chicken tequila fettuccine, spinach & asparagus spaghettini, and a bbq chicken pizza. It was a pretty big portion for a personal size, but everyone was satisfied with their orders and we had a nice time. Our waitress came and checked on us frequently as well :) Good food and good service!

Friday night and not packed at all. Hey...I'm not complaining. Came here with my friends and their kids. Service was fast. We ordered the artichoke dip to share, which was very good i must say. As for my entree I went with the Kungpao spaghetti with chicken and shrimp. It was great with the perfect heat. Oh we also had the butter cake topped with vanilla ice cream for dessert. Boy...was that thing to die for!! Food is good here. I would Definitely coming back.

I came to this place after catching a movie. I have frequented this place quite a few times but this has probably been the worst experience.  I ordered the avocado egg rolls which were delicious and the shrimp & chicken lettice wraps which I didnt get a chance to try due to it was served with a bed of dirty lettice and on a dirty plate with food stains. Service: took forever to check on us after serving food on a disgusting plate... We sat at least 15 minutes without being helped. Horrible

Service: Quite crowded on a Saturday night, yet got our seats assigned immediately because of the efficient service. We requested the seats near the window, and got one assigned quickly. Food and beverage service was quick, our server took great care of us in spite of being very busy. Food: We had many vegatarian options. The food was good but not very delicious  The sangria was amazing Ambience: Crowded but neat and chic. Kids friendly.

Went here for the first time with my boyfriend and we split a half Cesar Salad and and an Original Hand Tossed 5 Cheese & Tomato Pizza, which was plenty of food for both of us! The pizza was pretty good and so was the salad (I have had better though). I think what was even better was the was our server, I wish I could remember her name or saved the receipt, but I didn't :/. She was super nice & friendly and on it the whole time we were there. She checked in made sure everything was ok and always made sure our drinks were full, which I find a lot of servers don't do. I can't be the convenience of how close it is to home so I will be back!

Always a good experience at CPK.  Our server today was Jessica, she was attentive and friendly, thank you for the great service.  The kung pao shrimp spaghetti is a dish that I order each time without fail.

3 stars overall 4.5 stars for service from our server Ben Ben didn't go above and beyond but he was the best server he could be and had a great attitude. It's never easy serving a table with kids but he was a great sport and didn't show any attitude or negative emotion whatsoever. Esp asking for extra plates and utensils. Was very easy going and cool about everything. Made the overall experience better than it could have been.  The food took a little while to come out.  Chicken in the Chinese chicken salad $15.29 was kind of dry so we asked for more dressing Pesto cream penne $11.99 was okay for me. Bland for others.  California veggie pizza $13.99 was on the healthier side with the extra veggies which I appreciate. Not bad as a vegetarian option. I wouldn't mind ordering it again.  Last time I came here, the gluten free crust option made the overall pizza seem kind of undercooked. I decided to opt out of it this time.

Good Food, drinks are weak for the price, so just stick with wine. I love the fact that you can get samples of the wines before you buy them. Waiters are very nice and they always make sure you are satisfied with your food or they will remake it for you. Love this place. Yummy.

The service here was great! Our server was super friendly and helpful. And the food was delicious! We were just disappointed that the salmon on our quinoa and arugula salad was fried. We didn't think it would be cooked. But otherwise, food was great!

Walking out of the plaza with family I turned to ask my grandmother if she had eaten. She was hungry, so we walked into this restaurant. We were greeted and taken to sit down. My uncle asked to be seated at a booth (my grandmother is diabetic and has bad knee problems). The waitress told us that that would not be possible because the waitress who tended to that area would not be off of her break for another two minutes. My family insisted and so we were sat at a booth. The waitress who was supposedly on break came right away to serve us. We told her that we understood if she was on her break we were willing to wait. She told us she had been off of her break for more that five minutes. We told her what happened with the hostess who greeted us; Zulema, the waitress assured us not to worry. She brought the manager over and the issue was taken care of. Zulema was an amazing waitress, noticing that my family was from México she spoke to us in spanish, and she treated us as if we were her family. Although the experience could have started off better, we had somewhat of a great night. The food was pricey but it was satisfying.

in truth, I wasn't expecting much when we stopped here to grab a bite after the State Fair.  It wasn't our first choice but was what we agreed upon.  Yes, I have been to California Pizza Kitchen before but it was many years ago and my pizza like has changed dramatically. Wedge salad to start followed by two (thin crust) pizzas:  * pear and gorgonzola   * spinach and artichoke Not very impressed with the wedge salad.  Dressing was blah, bacon was chewy, and the lettuce hadn't been shaken (still very wet) creating a pool of water. The pizza, however, was impressive.  The crusts were cooked well, toppings distributed, not over loaded.  Just enough to capture the flavor and texture combination of each.  Plenty left over and carried home. I did have an attitude (the "really? pizza? chain?" attitude) so I ddn't completely browse the menu for all the options available.  I later found they offer a flatbread ... that's next on my next visit.

I've been going to this restaurant for over 10 years. Not only is it in a great location but the staff has always been amazing! I don't think I've ever had a bad experience here. From the host/hostess to the management, you can tell they all care about your visit. And the food? Sooooo good!

This was the first time eating at this location. Our server Brianna was really awesome. She was on top of her game. She brought our food to our table in a timely manner and she even brought refills without us even having to ask for one. Good looking out! The food was wayyyyy better than any other location we've eaten at. That pizza was off the hook! I send my thanks to the cooks and Brianna for doing such a great job! Oh! And not to mention the seemingly updated décor compared to the other locations.
The area is clean and well ventilated, the service is okay. Hosts could be a bit more engaging, but would I be chipper if on my feet in one place for most of the day?

I had a horrible experience this evening with CPK on Arden.  After a difficult day -- a car accident that left me laid up, I decided to order CPK for delivery through a 3rd party delivery service.  The delivery service's job is to pick up the order and deliver it, that's it.   When I ordered, however, on a system that send the information to CPK, along with notes, I ordered 2 salads and specifically added "please don't forget the dressing."  This note was made because this particular restaurant is notorious for leaving something out of to go orders.  Well, the delivery was made and, no dressing. I called the delivery service who was quite obnoxious about it (so I won't be using Food to You anymore), but did offer pick up my dressings.  Well 2.5 hours later, no dressing. I got in the car and drove over.  I called on the way to ask if they could have two dressings ready.  The young woman on the phone (the hostess I learned when I arrived) was very sweet and very helpful and apologized for the missing dressings.  So, when I arrived, I was quite surprised when the Manager decided to question ... a woman who ordered a delivery, because she had an accident and was laid up, who drove over 7 miles to retrieve dressing for those salads ... really?  She insisted I must have received the salad dressing because she personally had been helping with the take-out orders. Again, who lies about receiving salad dressing on a delivery order simply to drive over for 2 1/4 cup size dressings? When I questioned why she was questioning me, she said she wasn't (although when she left the man waiting next to me confirmed for me how rude she was to me!).  When she returned with 2 dressings she shoved them at me and barked "I'm sorry."  I could have just taken the dressing and left ... but she was so rude I asked if I could speak to the manager.  Well, it turned out SHE IS THE MANAGER!  Wow.  I work for a very large organization that serves customers (members actually) and if any one of my staff treated them the way she treated me, they'd have some pretty serious explaining to do. I've registered my complaint with CPK Corporate Offices as well. I won't be going back to CPK again.

Best CPK I have ever been too.  Hands down best staff and we met the manager and she was great too! Fresh food and always fun. I feel lucky to have this so close to home.  It does get cold in the restaurant but bring a sweatshirt and enjoy!

This is truly one of my favorite pizza places ever. I pretty much get the same thing every time I come here too.  They offered us some bread and oil to start while we looked at the menus. The oil has a distinct mixture of herbs in it that makes it fantastic. We also usually get the hummus and pita bread appetizer. The hummus is very good because it's simple. It's not like most kinds you get from the grocery store, it's very plain and I like that. For dinner I also keep it simple with just pepperoni pizza. Their thin or regular crust is very good. In the pizza they sprinkle another herb for flavor that is so unique to their restaurant, I've never had it like that anywhere else. Again, I really love it it's what makes California Pizza Kitchen so edgy and different. The staff was very friendly and always is every time I come here. Last night we sat at the bar where we could see the guys tossing pizza dough and putting the pizzas in the fire oven. Really neat environment to have dinner in and is why my boyfriend and I love it. I do have to mention, although it's silly, my chair was broken last night and I was rocking back and forth during my meal. No big deal, I could've moved over, because we were the only ones sitting at the bar, however it seems like if a child or elderly person got that stool it could be dangerous. The meal is a little pricey I have to say. Last night we skipped the appetizers and drinks, we only had water. For two pizzas we paid almost forty bucks. That's why I gave four outta five stars.

The lunch special has been my go to for awhile now. I love I can get a small pizza and a salad combo.  Yesterday while dining my friend notice a bug crawling around on the floor by my foot. Sure did resemble a cockroach. Gross. We let our server no and the manager I believe came and picked it up and acted as if nothing was wrong. Needless to say I no restaurants have a hard time with bugs but other than the bug being picked up nothing was done for my inconvenience. It will be hard for me to return to CPK.

If you wanna eat with the bugs this is the place to go!!!!  Sat in the very back by the window and we killed at least 15 little gnats flying around the window. Austin was our waiter he was sweet but he seemed a little out of it. Every time we asked him a question his response was always "definitely" He didn't even pay attention to our questions. Spoke with the manager about the gnats, her name was Casey and all she said was they just got done spraying so once the bug people spray the gnats come out... Ummmmmm isn't that why you're paying people to spray  so that the bugs go the hell away?!!!?? I had the tequila chicken fettuccine it was delicious... Two stars just for the food, my hats off to the chef's! service and management zero stars

You want to know what torture is, call this store and ask to place an order for delivery. First, Yelp is WRONG. This location does not deliver. You have to order via GrubHub or Caviar. When I called I spoke to three separate people who didn't even know how to answer my question. Lots of "uh" and "well" and more "uh"... and I got put on hold - all three times - so they could go find an answer, or a clue, or a brain, or perhaps a small pebble to play with. Not sure how they are still in business and apparently so highly regarded in recent reviews. I guess that is some powerful insight into the lack of brain skills there are behind all those 2+ star reviews. They either don't expect much or are lying. After my previous experience (see photos) - and their unbelievable reaction to it - I assume now that the hiring standards have taken a nose-dive.

Been to numerous California pizza kitchen in different cities and state, but this location was a no go for me. As I entered, we got sat down immediately. There was a certain booth I wanted to be sat at but most were empty but tables were filled with dirty plates. So we got sat right underneath the sun. Mind you it was 98 degrees today.  Ordered an avocado egg roll for an appetizer, chipotle chicken pizza, and my fiancé ordered a chicken fettuccine pasta. At first they served us bread and got our appetizer fast. As we finished it, we set it aside for them to pick up when we get our main entrée. But when we got our food, she ignored our plates. Wasn't much room on the table to share our food with each other. The avocado egg roll was good but my pizza was just mushy. I couldn't lift it up without the topping falling all over my plate. Since the toppings were heavy, the pizza wouldn't hold up right even when I fold it. The dough was still chewy. And my fiancé pasta dish just looked so sad and unappetizing. He said it was bland and the chicken had no flavor. This pasta dish was about $16, not worth it. I had come in at a time where it wasn't busy. my waitress just took our order, didn't check up on us, nor could I find her. I was in need of more water since the pizza was spicy but since she was not around, I had to take my fiancé drink. Although he needed a drink too, he insisted on me having the last sip. Then she appeared out of no where to give us our check, but before she can walk away, I asked her loudly for more water for both of us.  Overall it wasn't that great for me. But wouldn't stop me from coming back to this location to try it again once more.

I'm surprised I never bothered to check this place out. It's a trendy, little spot. They serve their lunch specials until 4 PM. Today I got the mushroom, sausage and pepperoni pizza with a loaded baked potato soup and my sister got the turkey brie sandwich with a quinoa, cranberry salad and we also split a side of fried mac and cheese. I loved the pizza and the cranberry salad. Their potato soup was slightly grainy, but still tasted good. The turkey and brie sandwich was on the bland side. Everything totaled up to about $30. Not too bad. I would be down to try their main entrees next time.

FOOD - Lunch Duos: Half Sandwich & Soup -- Oven-Roasted Turkey & Brie: turkey, brie, pear slices, and baby greens with honey mustard sauce. Great mesh of flavors. 4/5 -- Baked Potato Soup: pureed potatoes with bacon and green onions. Yummy! 4/5 - Lunch Duos: Pizza & Salad -- The Original BBQ Chicken Pizza: chicken, BBQ sauce, gouda, red onions, and cilantro on thin crust. Yummy! The chicken was tender enough. 3.75/5 -- The Mediterranean Salad: romaine, tomatoes, garbanzos, feta, black olives, and red onions with a vinaigrette. Decent salad. 3/5 - White Corn Guacamole & Chips: diced avocado, white corn, black beans, jicama, bell peppers, cilantro, and serrano peppers. Served with tortilla chips. I like chunky guacamole but this was practically all chunks which made it difficult to eat. I felt like it was missing something. It was a little on the bland side. 3/5 SERVICE We were immediately greeted and seated. Our server was professional and attentive. 5/5 FINAL THOUGHTS I would definitely come back! They have tons of dishes on their menu I would like to try.

BEST DESSERT EVER!! My daughter and I for the first time ate the butter cake and we almost died and went to heaven! I believe this is one of the best desserts I have ever had at a restaurant in my entire life...at least my top 3...wow!

The food was excellent, usual CPK faire. This particular CPK gets only three stars because: 1. Service was terrible. Our waitress dropped off our food and never came back to check on us. I had to go & ask another waiter to refill our drinks.  2. Our area of the restaurant was less than clean. The floor definitely needed to be swept. The tables weren't set for incoming patrons. We've been to 5-6 CPK's other than our own here in Fresno (which is always excellent) and this is the only one that hasn't been a 5 star. There are too many restaurants in Sacramento we can go to and get better service.
My 13 year old son said I needed to leave 5 stars. So,  here I am.  Great service,  great food.

Came in on Veterans day, they were offering deals for vets which was nice. We had about a 20 minute wait and then we were seated. We ordered fairly quickly, however our apps came out with our lunch, which took a little while to make it out. I had a small pizza and salad which was pretty good. I did have a water and on the refill it came back tasting like sewer water so I sent it back and they brought out fresh. Overall ok experience but not dying to rush back.

A friend was visiting from out of town and we took our kids here for a late lunch. The horrible service started when we walked in.  The hostess took our names and said it would be 5 to 10 minutes. Ten minutes later we asked about our table and she said it would be 10 more minutes. A few minutes later, she seated a party with the same number of people and they arrived after us. The server, manager and waiter were all rude and acted like they didn't care about good customer service. At least the food was good but I wouldn't go back to this location again.
I updated my review because the owner or management handled the situation accordingly. They were wonderful and apologized for what happened the night I visited. Thank you very much.

First time here and it was for my lunch break with my friends and the service was very quick and the food was yummy! We did the pizza and soup combo (I believe you can also do salad with it too). Sorry bad on the details I don't remember which pizza I chose but I had the baked potato soup and it was good!

Bad service. They were not accommodating at all. Mojitos SUCK there. They taste like minute maid lime aid. Sent it back and they were at first nice about it and let me choose a completely different drink. Then charged me $5 extra for changing my drink. Meanwhile the bartender was pointing at our table and was pissed. Choose a different restaurant

Update 02/12/2017: Enjoyed a marvelous dinner with my baby daughter and our wonderful friend. What a positive experience! Our waitress is a living doll. Her name is (Jillian or Jullian), couldn't hear well. Anyhow, she provided superb service, beautiful smile as she served and catered to our palates. Our appetizers and dinner was served timely and piping hot. Each dish seasoned to perfection. Excellent food. Excellent service. Excellent experience. Thank you! Update: 1/21/2017: Great and genuine customer care follow up on concerns from original review post. Communication consistent throughout the process of initial inquiry through resolution. Thank you California Pizza Kitchen Owner and Team.
Service was OK nothing special. Food was OK not as good as usual. Maybe a day off. Wish they checked dishes before they leave kitchen.

My daughter was ready to leave for college again after winter break and so we went out a lot to eat.  I decided to take her here and we ordered the Spinach Artichoke Dip and I had the Jambalaya Fettuccine.   The waiter was extremely nice and he always returned to check if we were ok or if we needed anything else.  5 stars for that.   The food came and I enjoyed the Spinach Artichoke dip.  The chips tasted fresh and the dip was so creamy.  So delicious. I couldnt stop myself.  Usually I control myself because I know I need room in my tummy for my main dish. The Jambalaya Fettuccine was also delicious.  It loved the spices.   I had a great experience. I would definitely return.

Love their garlic cream fettuccine. It's enough saltiness and creamy flavor. I like how they don't overpower the pasta with chunks of cheese. The noodles they used weren't the extra fat ones, which I like since the noodles were just at the right softness. The shrimp was cooked to perfection, but I wish the tail wasn't on there, since it made it a little tougher to get the whole shrimp. The amount they give you is a good amount. Their BBQ chicken pizza was okay. It was a little salty, but there was enough ingredients on top and the crust wasn't too thick or thin. I wouldn't choose to order it again... I may just not be a fan of pizza that much. The Brussels and bacon flatbread was nothing out of the ordinary. I would save your appetite for the real meal instead and pass on this dish. Oh yeah, happy hour from 8:00pm-CLOSE :) I would actually come back here for their garlic cream fettuccine only.

Came today after many years of not being in the retail sales working next door to dine for lunch with my gf.  I've always loved their chicken avocado egg rolls as well as their chicken tequila fettuccini.  They have definitely stepped up their game with the interior remodeling.  Everything was bright and vibrant with wood accents.  I love anything wood decor.  Unfortunately, that was the only good thing about the days visit.  My gf drinks a lot of water and we always had to ask for water refills.  Even when they saw that she was empty, they would state they would get her some more water... but no water ever came.  Our fettuccini was undercooked.  Some pieces of the pasta were harder than other pieces and barely had any of the creamy sauce I remember loving.  I mentioned it to our waiter which was kind enough to offer us something else in which we declined.  We were on a time crunch so we did not have time to wait for a new dish or something else and we hate being those that send items back.  Our avocado egg rolls were super salty which was super disappointing because I had just raved about them to my gf before ordering the dish.   Overall, food was disappointing.  Service was mediocre for only having 1/5 of the restaurant full.  I used to think CPK was different in not tasting like a chain restaurant but they've definitely killed my vibe.
My hubby and I have been here several times, and ordered take out online many times. Each visit here has had things-great food and excellent customer service.

5 stars for the service!   My dating person and I were doing the dating thing at this location on Sunday, 3/5.  We were helped by Jackie- and while neither of us are yelpers, we wanted to take a minute to give a shout out to her! She was super friendly without being overwhelming and checked on us often without going overboard.  She engaged in some good conversation with us and gave solid drink and food recommendations... My life has been forever changed by the citrus crush cocktail that she suggested!!  As someone who's worked in customer service type jobs for many years I always notice and appreciate when someone who helps me is especially present and friendly. Me and said dating person definitely noticed and remarked on how great the service was! Anyways world- 'twas a solid dining experience, you should go for it!

It was pretty good. The service was nice, though the food took a bit long. It is usually busy during dinner time, especially on weekends. The parking was okay, though since it is in a shared plaza, other cars are there too.

I go here occasionally especially when I am around the Arden area. I have the same usual that I always order which is the Kung pao spaghetti with chicken and shrimp. It is my favorite because of its unique flavoring and battered shrimp and chicken. When I ordered it last night, portions of chicken seemed less compared to before, not sure if they are changing the portion size. My friend had ordered the garlic cream fettuccine with both chicken and shrimp which surprisingly turned out to be a great dish. The plate was packed with flavor and endless shrimp. That was the first time we ordered it and will definitely order it again; although, it would be complimentary if they had some sort of garlic bread to pair with the pasta. Our waitress was pretty exceptional, she kept checking in on us, offered some of her recommendations, and overall was very attentive. Additionally, wait times here aren't as long, we went on a Friday night and was seated after 7-10 minutes. Parking can be a hassle especially since it's right in the Arden mall complex.  P.s They also do curbside.

As far as chain restaurants go, cpk is a reliable favorite.  I can get food that is healthy, but not too healthy that it's tasteless.  Kids love the cheese pizza and all the extra sides that can be added from the kids menu, for a reasonable price.  I appreciate whenever any restaurant offers different sizes of plates.  Salads can be ordered in half and whole portions. More places need to do this.  Staff is friendly and the past couple of times,management came around to make sure everyone was doing well.

Terrible service, that dude Joey is so rude, I will never come back to this place my pizza was cold, Armani doesn't even know how to take an order, that guy Nicholas gave me three prices of bread for five people what sense does that make. 1 star

Great customer service on Easter !! The fellow in the front wearing a pink shirt greeting and seating  everyone was awesome we were a group of nine and they accommodated A new table bigger and more spacious for us, at the end of our visit he brought the kids easer eggs and kindly waited while they were picking their eggs , the food was great and so was the waitress keep up the good work guys !!! Happy Easter

I tried the Lemongrass Chicken and was not impressed. The bok choy that it came with was not thoroughly washed as I could feel dirt particles crunching in my mouth. The flavor was more Americanized and I did not smell any lemongrass scent or see signs of its use. The plate was tiny for a fairly pricey dish. I guess I should just stick to pizza. I felt very comfortable sitting and eating inside the restaurant. It was very clean and spacious. There is plenty of arming as it is in a mall. Customer service was good. My waiter asked if I wanted bread prior to bringing it out.

This place is amazing, fantastic, beyond that even! I have never tasted food that is so good beyond belief! I ordered food I wasn't sure I like, I decided to go with something simple like the 4 cheese pizza. Also tried their guacamole and avocado egg rolls. I was about to pick out things I did not like, but I went for it. I'm so glad I did! Let me tell you that I absolutely HATE tomatoes and onions that they can get me sick.  Yet somehow, they made them the most delicious thing on this planet to me. The tomatoes on the 4 cheese pizza taste so amazing and juicy that if you REALLY HATE tomatoes , just listen to me, don't take them out! The food here is beyond amazing. I was very skeptical to come in because the place didn't have a real title name to me, sounded like some cheap place (and I'm always going with the most expensive things). I only came because I got gift cards and it was just too good, to die for! The employees are beyond amazing as well, you just have to give them a fantastic tip because they are really awesome and attentive but not overly so that it gets annoying. I am in love with this place and I will come here a lot more and recommend it to anyone and everyone. (Also you must get two or more orders of the guacamole, you'll be in love more than you ever thought you'd be)

Always amazed at their wonderful service! Never disappointed with their foods. Their pizzas are amazing and delicious! My daughter loves their California Club pizza. I love it even more cause of their fresh ingredients and she is eating her veggies at the same time. Win win!  I had their Jambalaya Fettuccine, it was delish!!! I've also had their Wild Mushroom Strozzapreti...that was absolutely amazing! It was nice and hearty, that is how I like my pasta dishes! This place will be our number one stop whenever we are in the area or shopping at the Mall.

One of my favorite places to dine. Went here for a first date with my current boyfriend and now we always go back! He introduced me and now I'm hooked. The dining area is absolutely beautiful and I love the big windows, especially at night. The little booth seats near the windows are my favorites, I always choose those seats. I know it's a pizza place hence the name, but my favorite is the spaghetti. It's so addicting! Not so saucy and I love it with the sautéed mushrooms. Just talking about it makes me want to go get some! It's in a good area. You can watch a movie before you eat or eat after you watch a movie and you'll never have to go outside lol. I love that Barnes and noble is right across from it in the building. This is a must go if you've never been!
I love the food but they clearly need to work on their pest control. I saw a mouse and it was disgusting. Never going back to this place again.

Omgosh I can't believe I haven't frequented this restaurant sooner!  It's classy, minimalistic & modern. All the elements I like in a lovely restaurant. Plus parking out front is free & endless. When we first entered we were taken to a booth by CPK's hostess right away with no hesitations. Our male waiter was just as quick asking what we wish to drink. Brought us our waters with lemon & their house bread with olive oil. We ordered half salads: Thai Crunch with no cilantro & Quinoa with Arugula. I asked specifically if the Thai Crunch was spicy the waiter said no. When I tasted it it was a bit spicy but luckily the waiter made sure my water was filled. Our half salads were more than enough. I can't imagine getting a full salad! That would have been way too much!Anyway I thought my Thai Crunch salad was perfect in taste and crunch. I would order it again definitely. Hubby enjoyed his quinoa & arugula salad & would order his salad again. I sampled his salad twice and thought it was tasty.  The waiter checked on us twice. Second time asking if we wished to have dessert. I passed this time but maybe next time! I have to admit our first time here the service & food were impeccable. Even a second person checked on us. That rarely happens! You know what? We will be back sooner than the time I waited to try this restaurant. Don't ask me why I waited. Too much CFA? Maybe. We need to cut down there for sure! CPK here we come!!!

It's more like 4 1/2 stars... Overall, our server was busy with other tables.  Other servers had to come and help with our table. We had a party of ten just as restaurant was starting to get busy.   Our server originally only brought out one plate of bread which was eaten in one minute.  The main entrees were brought out relatively quickly.  At the end, it seemed to take a while to pay our bill so we could leave.

6/30/17 Surprisingly, this place was above my expectations. We came here during lunch time and were sat right away. Our server was very friendly and personable; he told plenty of jokes during our visit. He talked us into ordering a couple of drinks due to the hot weather. I was surprised that the sangria flights tasted pretty good. Happy my girlfriend was there to order it because I probably would never order that for myself. We decided to take advantage of their lunch specials which were just the right amount of food at affordable prices. The food was out very quickly and prepared to perfection. We bother were able to order to items each with our alcoholic beverages for under $40. In my opinion that is a geat deal. Overall i had a great experience here. The food was amazing, the speed of service was fast and every interaction we had with the staff was genuine. They gave a lasting impression.

I've been eating at California pizza kitchen for years...always pleased until today! This particular location is the worst customer service and meal I've ever been served! I had to ask for a fork, napkins, and bread. The portion of the meal smaller then normal. What they call scampi is small shrimp. Don't order the scampi zucchini pasta!

I haven't been to a CPK in years, since my 6th grade birthday party or something and I love "new" ambiance and the feel. Walked in at 8:30 on a Thursday night and was seated immediately. Our server Terry was so friendly and he gave us the perfect amount of time to decide on drinks and then to order. I ordered the agave mojito and it was both delicious and strong. The food came out very quickly, and I was pleasantly surprised because the quality was much better than I had expected. The BBQ chicken pizza was chock full of toppings and the crust was cooked perfectly. Not too soft, nicely crispy. We also ordered the garlic fettuccine Alfredo and we added mushrooms. I loved that the pasta wasn't overly saucy, because most places tend to drown their pastas in sauce.  All in all it was a perfect dinner. I actually can't believe that this CPK experience was so different from my past one like a decade ago!

I definitely like to come get a gourmet style pizza at California Pizza Kitchen the drinks are always pretty good I think it's a little on the pricey side but who isn't these days, and the seating is a little tight but not overly done. I don't come here too often only because of its location from my house, but they never let me down I've been going here for several years now and all I have are great things to say. I recommend the pasta with the Crawfish and chicken and andouille sausage.

I have not had a meal at any California Pizza Kitchen since I was young enough to order off the children's menu!  By that comment, you can deduce it has been quite some time since I have returned.  Low and behold, I decided to meet my friend here today for lunch.  I will say, the decor and ambiance were nice.  The restaurant and the bathrooms were both very clean and well lit, which is a plus.  I was not greeted upon arrival at the restaurant and instead saw myself in to the table my friend was already waiting for me at.  We ordered drinks to start until we decided to split the garlic chicken pizza and the full Caesar salad.  We asked for the caramelized onions to only be placed on half of the pizza, as my friend does not care for onions.  Instead there were onions on the entire pizza and only scallions on half.  So my friend was disappointed and decided to eat the salad instead.  The Caesar salad had great flavor and the Parmesan was fresh; I even enjoyed the butter croutons, a nice touch.  After, the waitress did not come back ever to refill our water glasses.  She lost our check with the credit card for awhile before she scrambled around the restaurant looking for our paid check.  She was not the best waitress and didn't seem like she cares to really try at her job (don't think she wanted to be there).  Overall, for the price I don't think the quality was up to par and the service is definitely lacking.  Do not plan to return here again.

Upon walking into the restaurant for lunch, we were greeted by a friendly hostess and seated at a table right away.  I loved how bright and wide-open the design of the seating area is   Our waiter, Austin, was wonderful.  He took our order quickly, brought us some freshly-baked warm bread and dipping oil while we waited for our food, made sure to check up on us throughout our meal, and made sure our glasses were always filled with water. We shared an order of baked Tortilla Spring rolls: one Mediterranean Veggie roll (Wild mushrooms, eggplant, sun-dried tomatoes, caramelized onions, Mozzarella and Parmesan. Served with marinara) and one Thai Chicken roll (Peanut sauce, bean sprouts, scallions, carrots, fresh cilantro and Mozzarella. Served with Thai peanut sauce.)  It was a bit pricey for two rolls.  I liked both of them but preferred the veggie roll's milder flavor. We also shared a pizza: the California Club which featured applewood smoked bacon, roasted chicken, mozzarella, and topped with avocado, wild arugula, fresh torn basil and Romaine tossed in lemon-pepper mayo.  While I loved the chewy, toasty crust, I didn't really care for what was essentially a salad on top of my pizza!  It was difficult to execute: biting into my piece of pizza without the loose arugula falling off.  After the first slice as-is, I had to scrape the greens off.  But, what was left behind was a sauceless piece of pizza with noticeably salty bacon pieces.  The pizza's "sauce", a tasty lemony mayo, was on the greens that I'd scraped onto the butter plate!   But. The balance of flavor was restored back to the pizza after Austin kindly brought us a side of that mayo and we spread it on like butter!  I'm glad we tried the pizza, it tasted good except for the overly salted bacon. The execution was interesting but I'll keep my salads and pizza separate next time!

Pretty good food. The menu recently changed to include much more non-pizza items. The menu is actually predominantly non-pizza items now. There's usually a wait because of its proximity to the movie theater and Arden Fair Mall.

I sent my diet coke back twice because the glass was dirty. My to-go box was greasy before I put my food in it. Totally disgusting. They need to raise their cleanliness standards. The manager was rude and unprofessional.

I don't usually review chain restaurants because I'm not a fan of them but went to Cpk tonight and have to give 4 stars because of our waitress Corrina! She was awesome, just beyond nice and efficient. If I have to go to a chain restaurant I would go back here because of her service.

We've been to CPK all over Northern California and by far this is the best one. Their serving portion is very generous including their house bread. They always have the thin crust pizza that i like the most. Our service tonight by Terrell sealed the deal! He's attentive, quick and "happy". We're definitely gonna  stick to this branch from now on.

This place was delicious! From the bread and oil to the appetizer and main dish it was all amazing. Pizza is good, I've had a bit better Drinks are fantastic. I definitely recommend it and will be back soon.

Only had to wait 30 seconds before being seated last night.  Thursday nights at the mall are not so busy compared to the Christmas season. I doubt CPK will be so easy to venture into in a month.  Comfortable seating.  Quick and friendly fun service.  The "Reviver" beverage was a hit.  The Lemongrass Chicken was delicious and cooked perfectly.  The bread was hot and the dipping oil/seasonings were perfect.  I do recommend this restaurant if you're at Arden Mall and are looking for a nice restaurant to enjoy.
This place was delicious! From the bread and oil to the appetizer and main dish it was all amazing I definitely recommend it and will be back soon.

Came to this chain after wedding dress shopping for myself with my son and my best friend. The salad was delicious and our server was hilarious. I can't quite remember her name but she was Hispanic and was looking for something fun to do for Mother's Day with her kids. I'm glad we opted to visit because the beer was cold the food was great and the service was even

You gptta be some kinda genius of a company to think it's a good idea to have people fall in the same longass line for takeout orders and pickups. After sitting in a malfunctioning warmer for 15 minutes, my pizza was as cold and tough as a frisbee, and my "hot" soup was not. 5 stars specifically for the manager's (Bob) excellent customer service and keen eye. Had a great meal the food was awesome and the service was fine until we paid our bill and then decided we should have dessert on the spur of the moment. My sister politely asked the bartender, who was immediately in our line of sight because we were seated right next to the bar, for a dessert menu as our waitress had already left because the bill was paid and she thought we were leaving. Well his reply was so nasty that my sister was on the fence about whether or not we should ever go back. His tone, his body language and even his words gave the impression that he just could not be bothered. Bob to the rescue. He noticed the interaction from a distance. He came over and intervened in the conversation between my sister and the bartender in the most professional of ways. He was all too willing to take our order and even had a recommendation for how to save a relationship because the Butter Cake is absolutely to die for and would surely be worth a fight for the last bite. You know how you can have such a bad experience that you completely write off a business for good and nothing can fix it? Bob fixed it. A shining example of how interpersonal communication skills can go such a long way in providing a pleasant customer experience.

Service was not good.  For pasta Bolognese that costs $15 and sparkling water at $4ish, they could have tosser a slice of bread...very plain food...

Convenient location after or during a busy day of shopping. CPK has everything for you- great appetizers, pizza and sandwiches.  On this trip we got the chipotle chicken pizza with the lime sauce and the chicken tostada pizza for the low carb option. Also the chicken avocado rolls are the best. Can't find them anywhere else.
Great service! We came for lunch and were immediately seated. Had the gluten-free bbq chicken pizza, it was delicious! One of the best gluten free crusts we've had!
Our order was placed at 1:15 pm we were told it would be ready by 1:21 pm it is now 2:14 pm. I am shocked the food still is not ready. How can you hope to stay in business at this rate???

I can't believe I've never written a review about CPK Arden Fair! I come here all the time. It's one of my go to places in this part of Sacramento. Plus it's a good central location if you're meeting friends from different parts of town. It's in the part of the mall down by the movie theater. Lots of parking. Tip: Park in the back!!  I love how they have remodeled the restaurant. Lots of wood and textures. It feels very hip and modern, but cozy at the same time. I kind of wish my house looked like this place! LOL.  I always have great service here, even when it's very busy. When it's quiet I like to hang out and write or work on my phone. No one bothers you.  Great cocktails. I like the Honey Sangria....MMMMM. My go to food options are the Pepperoni, Sausage, Mushroom pizza or the Pesto Cream Penne with Chicken. Also, try the corn guacamole!!!

Placed an order through Door Dashers. Food arrived on time, but cold and stale. We ordered extra chicken on our salad and pasta and received scraps for the price. The dumplings were cold and gelatinous. The pizza was not fresh, and the pasta was virtually just noodles and sauce. Waste of money. Will never order from or dine in there again.
I've been here a few times. The poppers are soooo good and the mushroom pizza is to die for. The small side salads are huggeee! Have always had wonderful service. Can't wait to come here again.

This place is a fun place for a date or with family, we enjoy the food. The waiter forgot to refill our drinks but i don't blame him he was awesome; they were super busy and didn't think they were going to be busy so they were understaffed. Overall great job! I've been to their location in Colorado and in California and both had great food and great service!
The carne asada pizza was not that good. Not enough meat and vegetable. And the price for the pizza was disappointed. Carne asada pizza I ate does not look like this.
